quote: Sleep. The phone started up again. Logan squinted at the alarm clock: twenty-one minutes past four.
author: Stuart MacBride
title: Flesh House

quote: He hurt me to the point where I wanted to tell him something. My watch said 4.22 now. It had stopped. It was smashed.
author: Len Deighton
title: The Ipcress File

quote: 4:23, Monday morning, Iceland Square. A number of people in the vicinity of Bjornsongatan are awakened by loud screams.
author: John Ajvide Lindqvist
title: Let the Right One In

quote: 'We don't announce guests at' â he lifted his arm and turned it neatly to look at the narrow oblong watch on the inside of his wrist â 'at twenty-three minutes past four in the morning.' 'That's what I thought,' Degarmo said.
author: Raymond Chandler
title: The Lady in the Lake

quote: At 04:24 on January 5, 2025, the stars stood still in the sky. In California, the earthquake started with a low- frequency rumble. It wasn't a sound but a sensation that caused an incomprehensible weakness in the legs, a constriction of the bowels, and panic.
author: Carlos J Cortes
title: Perfect Circle

quote: As I dressed I glanced at my watch. It was no wonder that no one was stirring. It was twenty-five minutes past four.
author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
title: The Man with the Twisted Lip

quote: At twenty-six minutes past four, she was pronounced dead. Cause of death, or rather manner of death, was apparent. There were two bullet wounds of entry in her chest.
author: Ann Rule
title: If You Really Loved Me

quote: Bad footballers blame the pitch. And then I heard the school bell in my dream but it wasnt really a school bell and the pitch went very steep like a trap door opening and I fell and landed in bed. It was still dark and my alarm clock said 04:27 and I heard the noise again.
author: Matt Haig
title: The Dead Fathers Club

quote: He had been the only survivorâthe only one who'd come home alive. So what the hell was going on? Who was this new character in his nightmares? He glanced up at the clock and was disheartened to discover that it was only 0428 hours.
author: Glenn Smith
title: Solfleet: The Call of Duty

quote: 'Your pardon, Dr. Leving, but there is an urgent call for you. The pseudo-robot Caliban says he must speak with you at once.' Fredda sighed. She knew she had to take the call, and that Caliban would only call if it were important. But even so, it was turning into a very long night. 'Now what time is it?' she asked. 'It is now 0429 hours,' Donald said.
author: Roger MacBride Allen
title: Utopia

quote: 'What is it!' cried Merry. 'It is time to get up. It is half past four and very foggy. Come on! Sam is already getting breakfast ready. Even Pippin is up.
author: J. R. R. Tolkien
title: The Fellowship of the Ring

quote: An earthquake hit Los Angeles at 4:31 this morning and the images began arriving via CNN right away.
author: Douglas Coupland
title: Microserfs

quote: On his first day of kindergarten, Peter Houghton woke up at 4:32 a.m. He padded into his parents' room and asked if it was time yet to take the school bus.
author: Jodi Picoult
title: Nineteen Minutes

quote: When he heard the faint clunk of a steel gate closing behind them, he smiled in the darkness. They were out. He pressed a button on the watch and when its light showed him it was 04.33 his smile became a grin. No one had made it out of Greenacres for over a decade, which made Bishop's achievement that much sweeter. That was the kind of record he liked to beat.
author: Jason Dean
title: The Wrong Man

quote: It was 04:34 hours when I checked my watch and broke cover and walked across the packed snow to the barge and went aboard.
author: Adam Hall
title: Northlight

quote: No manner of exhaustion can keep a child asleep much later than six a.m. on Christmas Day. Colby awoke at 4:35.
author: C. Robert Cargill
title: Dreams and Shadows

quote: At 4:36 that morning, alone in my hotel room, it had been a much better scene. Spencer had blanched, confounded by the inescapable logic of my accusation. A few drops of perspiration had formed on his upper lip. A tiny vein had started to throb in his temple.
author: Ross Thomas
title: The Brass Go-Between

quote: Shaw laughed, apologized, and said he hoped that was true. He draped his kit over his head and snapped it in. Checked his watch. It was 0437 hours.
author: Ross Ritchell
title: Knife

quote: At 4.38 a.m. as the sun is coming up over Gorley Woods, I hear a strange rustling in the grass beside me. I peer closely but can see nothing.
author: Jonathan Barrow
title: The Queue

quote: At zero hour minus one minute, twenty-one minutes to five on March the twenty-first , Jiffy Tripp stood in the trenches beside an infantry officer, looking over no man's land. It was still dark. At zero hour plus five seconds the shell bursts actually threw a sort of witch's kaleidoscope onto no man's land, and he was reaching for the SOS rockets. Red â green â red.
author: Philip Child
title: God's Sparrows

quote: I settled into a daily routine. Wake up at 4.40am, shower, get on the train north by ten after five.
author: Tina Fey
title: Bossypants

quote: At 4:41 Crane's voice crackled through the walkie-talkie as if he'd read their thoughts of mutiny. 'Everyone into the elevator. Now!' Only moments before the call he and C.J. had finished what they hoped would be a successful diversion.
author: Roland S. Jefferson
title: Damaged Goods

quote: A large clock above the desks read, 04:42 am. He paused to listen. Whatever had happened there, appeared to be over.
author: Matthew Warwick
title: Dead City

quote: The time is four forty-three in the mornin an it's almost light oot there.
author: Suhayl Saadi
title: Psychoraag

quote: 'At 0444 hours yesterday morning, the landing craft Orpheus was appropriated by Dr. Diana Chandler, twenty-seven, an astrophysicist from Toronto, Canada. Dr. Chandler, apparently disconsolate over the failure of her husband, Aaron Rossman, also twenty-seven, also of Toronto, to renew their recently expired two-year marriage contract, presumably committed suicide. Mr. Rossman is the Starcology's dock master.'
author: Robert J. Sawyer
title: Golden Fleece

quote: His wife's breathing at his side is so faint that he can scarcely hear it. One of these mornings she'll be lying dead beside me and I won't even notice, he thinks. Or maybe it'll be me. Daybreak will reveal that one of us has been left alone. He checks the clock on the table next to the bed. The hands glow and register 4:45 a.m.
author: Henning Mankell
title: Faceless Killers

quote: The sun had risen at 04.46 and would not set until 21.26, and I'm not sure if there was a moon or not. At any rate I would not again be witness to that warm suspended light nor hear the bells pealing out inconsiderately as evening fell.
author: Javier MarÃ­as
title: All Souls

quote: 'His respiration increased right around the same time, and again around 04:47 this morning.' 'Could he be dreaming?' 'Coma patients don't dream,' Lilly said, her voice dropping as she turned and looked at Victor.
author: Gail Delaney
title: Outcasts

quote: Thinking about the card warms me to the idea of walking under the arched doorway of the Newtons' home, but when I arrive at their house, the plan seems ridiculous. What am I doing? It's 4:48 a.m., and I'm parked outside their darkened house.
author: Dave Eggers
title: What is the What

quote: At 4.48 the happy hour when clarity visits warm darkness which soaks my eyes I know no sin
author: Sarah Kane
title: 4.48 Psychosis

quote: When Costain left the bridge the brass chronometer in the wheelhouse said eleven minutes to five. Harkness looked at it and realised vaguely that the gap was still too big.
author: Elleston Trevor
title: Gale Force

quote: Even the hands of his watch and the hands of all the thirteen clocks were frozen. They had all frozen at the same time, on a snowy night, seven years before, and after that it was always ten minutes to five in the castle.
author: James Thurber
title: The 13 Clocks

quote: 'Earlier? It's nine minutes to five a.m.âwho would be up this early?' 'Oh, we're all early risers.
author: Jean Johnson
title: Gifts of the Magi

quote: 'I'm Carol Manning. This is Captain Willet.' 'What time is it?' 'If it matters, it's eight minutes to five. Don't get any persecuted ideas that I enjoy being out of bed at this time of night. It makes it legally easier if you invite us in.'
author: Gerald Seymour
title: Holding the Zero

quote: At seven minutes to five, one of the customer lines on the switchboard went off. It was the first time that a call had come in on that line since the hunt began, some nine hours before.
author: John Skipp & Craig Spector
title: The Light At The End

quote: Six minutes to five. Six minutes to go. Suddenly I felt quite clearheaded. There was an unexpected light in the cell; the boundaries were drawn, the roles well defined. The time of doubt and questioning and uncertainty was over.
author: Elie Wiesel
title: Dawn

quote: 4:55 - Mank holding phone. Turns to Caddell - 'Who is this?' Caddell: 'Jim.' (shrugs) 'I think he's our man in Cincinnati.'
author: Hunter S. Thompson
title: Fear and Loathing on the Campaign Trail '72

quote: And I was tired and out of cigarettes and still feeling a little hungover. The clock on the VCR was telling me it was four minutes to five in the morning. That just made it all seem even more surreal.
author: Greg Rucka
title: A Fistful of Rain

quote: The second said the same thing a few minutes before five, and mentioned eternity... I'm sure I'll meet you in the other world. Four minutes later she left a last, fleeting message: My love. Fernando. It's Suzana. Then, it seemed, she had shot herself.
author: Peter Robb
title: A Death in Brazil: A Book of Omissions

quote: He wants to look death in the face. Two minutes to five. I took a handkerchief out of my pocket, but John Dawson ordered me to put it back. An Englishman dies with his eyes open. He wants to look death in the face.
author: Elie Wiesel
title: Dawn

quote: The whole place smells like death no matter what the fuck you do. Gately gets to the shelter at 0459.9h and just shuts his head off as if his head had a control switch.
author: David Foster Wallace
title: Infinite Jest

quote: Wednesday morning at five o'clock as the day begins Silently closing her bedroom door Leaving the note that she hoped would say more She goes downstairs to the kitchen clutching her handkerchief Quietly turning the backdoor key Stepping outside she is free.
author: John Lennon & Paul McCartney
title: She's Leaving Home

quote: It was in the township of Dunwich, in a large and hardly inhabited farmhouse set against a hillside 4 miles from the village and a mile and a half from any other dwelling, that Wilbur Whately was born at 5 a.m. on Sunday, 2 February, 1913. The date was recalled because it was Candlemas, which people in Dunwich curiously observe under another name...
author: H. P. Lovecraft
title: The Dunwich Horror

quote: What causes young people to 'come out,' but the noble ambition of matrimony? What sends them trooping to watering-places? What keeps them dancing till five o'clock in the morning through a whole mortal season?
author: William Makepeace Thackeray
title: Vanity Fair

quote: There are worse things than having behaved foolishly in public. There are worse things than these miniature betrayals, committed or endured or suspected; there are worse things than not being able to sleep for thinking about them. It is 5 a.m. All the worse things come stalking in and stand icily about the bed looking worse and worse and worse.
author: Fleur Adcock
title: Things

quote: The day came slow, till five o'clock Then sprang before the hills Like hindered rubies, or the light A sudden musket spills
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Just after five o'clock on this chill September morning, the fishmonger's cart, containing Kirsten and Emilia and such possessions as they have been able to assemble in the time allowed to them, is driven out of the gates of Rosenborg?
author: Rose Tremain
title: Music & Silence

quote: It was 5:02 a.m., December 14. In another fifty-eight minutes he would set sail for America. He did not want to leave his bride; he did not want to go.
author: Brenda Joyce
title: The Prize

quote: It was 5:03 a.m. It didn't matter. She wasn't going to get back to sleep. She threw off her covers and, swearing at herself, Caleb and Mr. Griffin, she headed into the shower.
author: Heather Graham
title: Unhallowed Ground

quote: Oh yes. His clocks were set at one minute past five, four minutes past five and seven minutes past five. That was the combination number of a safe, 515457. The safe was concealed behind a reproduction of the Mona Lisa. Inside the safe, continued Poirot, with distaste, 'were the Crown Jewels of the Russian Royal Family.'
author: Agatha Christie
title: The Clocks

quote: The baby, a boy, is born at five past five in the morning.
author: Jhumpa Lahiri
title: The Namesake

quote: 5:06 a.m. I wake up strangely energized, my stomach growling. Upstairs, the overstocked fridge offers me its bounty of sympathy food.
author: Jonathan Tropper
title: This Is Where I Leave You

quote: His feet slammed into the ground; Ron staggered into him and he fell over; the Portkey hit the ground near his head with a heavy thud. Harry looked up. Mr Weasley, Mr Diggory and Cedric were still standing, though looking very windswept; everybody else was on the ground. âSeven past five from Stoatshead Hill,â said a voice.
author: J. K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

quote: ... and Ambrose and I will marry at Fort McHenry at 5.08 EDST this coming Saturday, Rosh Hashanah!
author: John Barth
title: Letters

quote: He had two hopes: first, that the bomb would work, and second, that ten thousand yards was far enough. The countdown started at nine minutes past five in the morning, Mountain War Time, on Monday, July 16.
author: Ken Follett
title: Winter of the World

quote: I settled into a daily routine. Wake up at 4:40am, shower, get on the train north by ten after five.
author: Tina Fey
title: Bossypants

quote: Today was Tuesday, the fifteenth of August; the sun had risen at eleven minutes past five this morning and would set at two minutes before seven this evening.
author: Donald E. Westlake
title: The Hot Rock

quote: At twelve minutes and six seconds past five o'clock on the morning of April 18th, 1906, the San Francisco peninsula began to shiver in the grip of an earthquake which, when its ultimate consequences are considered, was the most disastrous in the recorded history of the North American continent.
author: Herbert Asbury
title: Slummer's Paradise

quote: Lying on my side in bed, I stared at my alarm clock until it became a blemish, its red hue glowing like a welcome sign beckoning me into the depths of hell's crimson-colored cavities. 5:13 am. To describe this Monday as a blue Monday was an understatement.
author: Nakia D. Johnson
title: Uptempo

quote: The time was 5.14am, a very strange time indeed for the sheriff to have seen what he claimed he saw as he made his early-morning rounds, first patrolling back and forth along the deserted, snowbound streets of Kingdom City before extending his vigilance northward, along County Road.
author: Thomas H. Cook
title: Into the Web

quote: Weird conversation with Brown, a tired & confused old man who's been jerked out of bed at 5:15.
author: Hunter S. Thompson
title: Fear and Loathing on the Campaign Trail '72

quote: 5:16 - Mank on phone to Secretary of State Brown: 'Mr Brown, we're profoundly disturbed about this situation in the 21st. We can't get a single result out of there.
author: Hunter S. Thompson
title: Fear and Loathing on the Campaign Trail '72

quote: Sometimes bad luck is writ large and plain. 'What do you mean?' 'The clock stopped at seventeen minutes past five in the morning. Five one seven, dear. Add the digits and you get thirteen.'
author: Don DeLillo
title: Underworld

quote: By his watch it was just approaching eighteen minutes past five in the morning, a mere twelve minutes since the sun had first burst its brilliance across the eastern horizon.
author: Bernard Cornwell
title: Rebel

quote: The aeroplane struck the ground with vehement force at nineteen minutes past five on the morning of the eleventh of December, 1989. It immediately burst into flame.
author: Henning Mankell
title: The Pyramid

quote: He saw on the floor his cigarette reduced to a long thin cylinder of ash: it had smoked itself. It was five twenty, dawn was breaking behind the shed of empty barrels, the thermometer pointed to 210 degrees.
author: Primo Levi
title: The Periodic Table

quote: 'On the morning of the ninth instant, that is to say, yesterday, at twenty-one minutes past five o'clock in the morning, P.C. Whitstable was proceeding upon his usual beat and had reached the corner of Clarges Street and Piccadilly, when he heard a shout on the other side of the road, at the point where a path exits from The Green Park.
author: Garth Nix
title: The Curious Case of the Moondawn Daffodils Murder

quote: 'Yes,' she nodded. 'I will take off in the dark, and be over Tuti airfield at sunrise that's at 05.22 hours.'
author: Wilbur Smith
title: The Leopard Hunts in Darkness

quote: If I could count precisely to sixty between two passing orange minutes on her digital clock, starting at 5:23am and...
author: Arthur Phillips
title: The Tragedy of Arthur

quote: ... ending exactly as it melted into 5:24, then when she woke she would love me and not say this had been a terrible mistake.
author: Arthur Phillips
title: The Tragedy of Arthur

quote: George's train home from New Street leaves at 5.25. On the return journey, there are rarely schoolboys.
author: Julian Barnes
title: Arthur & George

quote: I think this is actually bump number 1,970. And the boy keeps plugging away at the same speed. There isn't a sound from them. Not a moan. Poor them. Poor me. I look at the clock. 05:26.
author: HallgrÃ­mur Helgason
title: 101 Reykjavik

quote: The tempo of the Cuban barrage suddenly picked upâshells seemed to be raining down at the rate of three or four a minute. At the sound, the South African officers looked up from their maps and discussion. Boerson checked his watch: 0527 hours. A little early, he thought, but the Cubans probably plan to give us one hell of a pasting before they attack. Wonderful.
author: Larry Bond
title: Vortex

quote: I pulled into the Aoyama supermarket parking garage at five-twenty-eight. The sky to the east was getting light. I entered the store carrying my bag. Almost no one was in the place. A young clerk in a striped uniform sat reading a magazine; a woman of indeterminate age was buying a cartload of cans and instant food. I turned past the liquor display and went straight to the snack bar.
author: Haruki Murakami
title: Hard Boiled Wonderland and the End of the World

quote: It was twenty-nine minutes past five, according to the red devilish numbers on the alarm clock, and she was being broken into.
author: Marian Keyes
title: The Brightest Star in the Sky

quote: On the day they were going to kill him, Santiago Nasar got up at five-thirty in the morning to wait for the boat the bishop was coming on.
author: Gabriel GarcÃ­a MÃ¡rquez
title: Chronicle of a Death Foretold

quote: For instance, it is half-past five in the summer morning. Young Chase's narrow bachelor bed has evidently been slept in, for it is rumpled in that barely disturbed way which can never be counterfeited. His jug's empty and there's grey water in the basin, cleanly boy. The window is open, admitting the salubrious sea-breeze. He doesn't smoke anyway. What an innocent room it is.
author: Timothy Mo
title: An Insular Possession

quote: 5:31 - Mank on phone to lawyer: 'Jesus, I think we gotta go in there and get those ballots! Impound 'em! Every damn one!'
author: Hunter S. Thompson
title: Fear and Loathing on the Campaign Trail '72

quote: By 05.32 the driver had come back from a corner shop with a six-pack of Coke, a bottle of Jack Daniels, some sachets of breakfast milk, an armful of stale cakes and a carton of Zhongncmhai cigarettes. The doors slammed shut and the van moved off.
author: Paul Mason
title: Rare Earth

quote: The next few stills showed them moving along the corridor, stopping at Hansen's door, the door opening although Hansen was out of view, and then, again, a blank corridor. The last two pictures were marked 05.33 and showed the same pair in the corridor, and then standing at the elevator, and then gone.
author: Bill Napier
title: Revelation

quote: I asked 'What time is sunrise?' A second's silence while the crestfallen Bush absorbed his rebuke, and then another voice answered: 'Five-thirty-four, sir.'
author: C.S. Forester
title: The Commodore

quote: 5:35 - All phones ringing now, the swing shift has shot the gap - now the others are waking up.
author: Hunter S. Thompson
title: Fear and Loathing on the Campaign Trail '72

quote: She drank a bottle of Jack Daniels. When she woke at 05.36 she had wiped the previous evening
author: Jonathan Meades
title: The Fowler Family Business

quote: Richard glanced at the clock on the microwave - 5:37 - almost twelve hours, almost one half-day since he'd dialed 911.
author: A. M. Homes
title: This Book Will Save Your Life

quote: It was now 0538 hours on the same day, Monday, December 21 and still dark. U-31 was sailing on the surface at fifteen knots. One of the four watchmen looking through his powerful Zeiss binoculars, did a double take. He wiped the lens on his sleeve and looked again.
author: Richard Wild
title: The Gunpowder Run

quote: George took his phone from the dressing table. 'The nightmare beat the alarm by just over an hour,' he said. 'It's twenty-one minutes to six.' 'Let me catch some more sleep,' she said groggily. 'And let me bath and make you some breakfast.' 'That's music to my ears. Don't forget that I'm three-in-one. I'll need to take some of your delicious cooking to work.' 'How can I forget that there are four of us now?'
author: Kudakwashe Muzira
title: The E Utopia Project

quote: Twenty minutes to six. 'Rob's boys were already on the platform, barrows ready. The only thing that ever dared to be late around here was the train. Rob's boys were in fact Bill Bing, thirty, sucking a Woodbine, and Arthur, sixty, half dead.
author: Bruce Robinson
title: The Peculiar Memories of Thomas Penman

quote: At 0541 he had spoken by VHF to the Captain of Ocean Mammoth who said that his ship was aground and that the DF bearing of the Agulhas radio beacon from the ship was 268Â°.
author: Antony Trew
title: Death of a Supertanker

quote: At eighteen minutes to six, they blew the wall, and even then, it was almost too late.
author: Greg Rucka
title: A Gentleman's Game

quote: 5.43 - Mank on phone to 'Mary' in Washington; 'It now appears quite clear that we'll lead the state - without the 21st.'
author: Hunter S. Thompson
title: Fear and Loathing on the Campaign Trail '72

quote: 'And what time, again, did the defendent actually say these words?' 'That would have been - you can see the time on the film tape on the frame where you've stopped it. 0544 hours.'
author: Perri O'Shaughnessy
title: Invasion of Privacy

quote: At 5:45 a power-transformer on a pole beside the abandoned Tracker Brothers' Truck Depot exploded in a flash of purple light, spraying twisted chunks of metal onto the shingled roof.
author: Stephen King
title: IT

quote: Herbert could feel nothing. He wrote a legal-sounding phrase to the effect that the sentence had been carried out at 5.46am, adding, 'without a snag'. The burial party had cursed him quietly as they'd hacked at the thick roots and tight soil.
author: William Brodrick
title: A Whispered Name

quote: His eyelids pried open. The bedside lamp was lit. Rue hovered over him, flicking her finger at his earlobe. What the hell? The clock said it was forty-seven minutes past five. Before dawn. On a Sunday.
author: Cassie Miles
title: Christmas Coverup

quote: A Bacardi mirror with fogged glass hangs above the backbar next to a St. Pauli Girl clock, the clock's hands frozen at twelve minutes to six
author: John Burnham Schwartz
title: Northwest Corner

quote: He looked at his watch. It was eleven minutes to six. After a moment he idly drew the center drawer of the desk out over his lap.
author: Flannery O'Connor
title: Everything That Rises Must Converge

quote: Now she glanced quickly at the clock. The time was ten minutes to six. 'Land sakes!' she exclaimed. 'I should say you was! What in the world got you up so early? Ain't sick, are you?' 'No,' replied the captain wearily. 'I ain't sick. I didn't sleep very well last night, that's all.'
author: Joseph Crosby Lincoln
title: Cy Whittaker's Place

quote: He paced the wooden boards and looked again,âten minutes to six. Then he stopped suddenly. Along that gleaming stretch of private road came a car, driven at a rapid pace. Prince Shan stood and watched it, and as he watched, it seemed almost as though the hidden sun had caught his face and transfigured it.
author: E. Phillips Oppenheim
title: The Great Prince Shan

quote: It was nine minutes to six o'clock and an hour before dawn. The brigade was not due to move today, and so, just as they did every other day, along with every British corps in the field, the four battalions stood to arms in case of attack. Each company paraded and then marched to form with its battalion at its alarm post. The time just before dawn was when men felt low in spirits and drowsy, making it a good time for the enemy to attack.
author: Adrian Goldsworthy
title: Whose Business is to Die

quote: At 5.52am paramedics from the St. Petersburg Fire Department and SunStar Medic One ambulance service responded to a medical emergency call at 12201 Ninth Street North, St. Petersburg, apartment 2210.
author: Mark Fuhrman
title: Silent Witness

quote: The gate log showed he'd signed out at seven minutes to six that morning, slightly earlier than usual. Because they were conscientious employees, the spaceport immediately called the police and sent someone around to Gemma Tivon.
author: Peter F. Hamilton
title: Fallen Dragon

quote: This morning, the sun came up at six minutes to six. There was already heavy early-morning rush-hour traffic on the Majesta Bridge. Meyer was driving. Carella was riding shotgun.
author: Ed McBain
title: Merely Hate

quote: 'Welcome back, sir.' Heskan smiled at a man whose name he could not recall and remarked good-naturedly, 'I see they have you working graveyards.' It was 05:54 and the graveyard shift would soon come off rotation, replaced by the daytime crew.
author: Britt Ringel
title: Loyalty to the Cause

quote: It was 5.55am and raining hard when I pedalled up to the bike stand just outside the forecourt of the station and dashed inside. I raced past the bookstall, where all the placards of the Yorkshire Post (a morning paper) read 'York Horror', but also 'Terrific February Gales at Coast'.
author: Andrew Martin
title: The Lost Luggage Porter

quote: He pulled out his own. The officer with the chipped nose went over to borrow the watch of General Feraud. They bent their heads over them for a time. 'That's it. At four minutes to six by yours.
author: Joseph Conrad
title: A Set of Six

quote: He drank his coffee and ate his rolls with an excellent appetite, and then he glanced at his chronometer. It was three minutes to sixâtime he went across to the barge.
author: Marie Belloc Lowndes
title: The Red Cross Barge

quote: Annika Giannini woke with a start. She saw that it was 5.58 a.m. â¦
author: Stieg Larsson
title: The Girl Who Kicked The Hornets' Nest

quote: Frankston glanced at his wristchrono. It was one minute to six. 'In about a minute,' he thought, 'Ross will say something about going out to water his geraniums.' The wristchrono ticked fifty-nine times. 'I think I'll go out and water my geraniums,' said Ross.
author: Lyn Venable
title: Homesick

quote: I had risen half-an-hour before her entrance, and had washed my face, and put on my clothes by the light of a half-moon just setting, whose rays streamed through the narrow window near my crib. I was to leave Gateshead that day by a coach which passed the lodge gates at six a.m.
author: Charlotte BrontÃ«
title: Jane Eyre

quote: On the 15th of September 1840, about six o'clock in the morning, the Ville-de-Montereau, ready to depart, pouring out great whirls of smoke by the quai Saint-Bernard.
author: Gustave Flaubert
title: L'Education Sentimentale

quote: The ball went on for a long time, until six in the morning; all were exhausted and wishing they had been in bed for at least three hours; but to leave early was like proclaiming the party a failure and offending the host and hostess who had taken such a lot of trouble, poor dears.
author: Giuseppe Tomasi di Lampedusa
title: The Leopard

quote: In the image, he was looking straight up at the camera, holding a disposable cup in his hand. The time signature on the bottom right corner of the screen said that it was 06:01 on the same morning the two of them had come to the convent.
author: Justin Cronin
title: The Passage

quote: Not two minutes past six. No. Nobody sleeps in, we're not a holiday camp. Now. I have more telephone calls to make.'
author: David Mitchell
title: The Bone Clocks

quote: I mean three minutes after six.' He laughed as he kept turning the dial. 'I remember once, a lad in Galway who didn't understand that. At midnight he set the timer to go off at one minute after twelve, in what he thought would be the afternoon.
author: Nelson DeMille
title: Cathedral

quote: It was four minutes past six in the morning. She shivered. She waited. She stretched because she had been sat in her car for three and a half hours before the milk float had turned into the street.
author: Gerald Seymour
title: Heart of Danger

quote: A second man went in and found the shop empty, as he thought, at five minutes past six. That puts the time at between 5:30 and 6:05.
author: Agatha Christie
title: The ABC Murders

quote: At 6:06, every toilet on Merit Street suddenly exploded in a geyser of shit and raw sewage as some unimaginable reversal took place in the pipes which fed the holding tanks of the new waste-treatment plant in the Barrens.
author: Stephen King
title: IT

quote: A family burned to death in a house-fire in Kreuzberg, a stabbing outside a bar in Wedding, a woman beaten to death in Spandau. The record of March's' own disrupted morning was last on the list: 06:07 [O] (that meant notification had come from the Orpo) 1H Havel/March.
author: Robert Harris
title: Fatherland

quote: At six oh-eight a.m. two men wearing ragged trench coats approached the Casino. The shorter of the men burst into flames.
author: Ilona Andrews
title: Magic Bleeds

quote: _6:09 a.m._ Annabel Reade listens to the alarm under her pillow. In the dim light of the bedroom she sees the paging signal blinking softly on the computer screen. Jasper is calling her, tapping out the opening lines of her favorite book, _Animal Farm_.
author: J. G. Ballard
title: Running Wild

quote: The bus left the station at ten past six - and she sat proud, like an accustomed traveller, apart from her father, John Henry, and Berenice. But after a while a serious doubt came in her, which even the answers of the bus-driver could not quite satisfy.
author: Carson McCullers
title: The Member of the Wedding

quote: This was at 06:11 and three minutes later I saw the front door of Sorgenicht's house open and a figure show up against the light inside. I had the engine running by the time he'd shut the door and I was rolling the Mercedes with the headlights on as he walked out of sight beyond the building at the end of the street.
author: Adam Hall
title: Quiller Solitaire

quote: The old Seth Thomas clock on Miss Corrie's mantel that probably had ticked away at least a century said twelve minutes past six, and it was still dark outside. A current of warm air had descended on the mountain during the night and thick fog clung to the landscape.
author: Mignon F. Ballard
title: The Angel and the Jabberwocky Murders

quote: As a light drizzle fell from the grey sky at 06:13 three Renault minivans with darkened windows came down a side street, heading for the mosque.
author: Gary Haynes
title: State of Attack

quote: Virtual curtains mirrored her movement, sliding across the screen and dimming the room lighting. The red numbers 06:14 faded but still showed in the top right hand corner. The colony would be rousing.
author: Bob Goddard
title: Mother Moon

quote: It was 6.15 am. Just starting to get light. A small knot of older teenagers were leaning against a nearby wall. They looked as though they had been out all night. Two of the guys stared at us. Their eyes hard and threatening.
author: Sophie McKenzie
title: Girl, Missing

quote: And, as they boarded the 06:16 to Mittelsteine, Erika toyed with the notion that although every metre of this journey took her further from her mother it would also bring her closer to the possibility of seeing Max again and the blossoming of their new little family.
author: Monika Jephcott Thomas
title: Fifteen Words

quote: Dizzy, come on.' He turned slowly, coaxing the animal down on to the pillow. The clock read six-seventeen. A second cat, Miles, purred on contentedly from the patch in the covers where Resnick's legs had made a deep V.
author: John Harvey
title: Lonely Hearts

quote: Ernest Wilkins woke to the clamour of the alarm. He had been thirty years away, reliving the spat between Five and Six over the surveillance operation on Peter Kroger's placeâ¦damn good operation, the more so because Six had wanted in and had been seen off. None of their business. It was eighteen minutes past six.
author: Gerald Seymour
title: The Journeyman Tailor

quote: 6.19 am, 8th June 2004, the jet of your pupil set in the gold of your eye.
author: Carol Ann Duffy
title: Venus

quote: It was 6:20 a.m., and my parents and I were standing, stunned and haf-awake, in the parking lot of a Howard Johnson's in Iowa.
author: Austin Grossman
title: Soon I Will Be Invincible

quote: The whipped mules dragged the wagon on through a flooded branch that submerged thirty yards of the road and stood up around the bushes and tree-trunks on either side so that they had no rootage, and I watched where and how deep the wheels went while I idled the motor and lighted Gudger's and my own cigarette. It was twenty-one past six.
author: James Agee & Walker Evans
title: Let Us Now Praise Famous Men

quote: Father expected his shaving-water to be ready at a quarter past six. Just seven minutes late, Dorothy took the can upstairs and knocked at her father's door.
author: George Orwell
title: A Clergyman's Daughter

quote: It was twenty-three minutes past six. He actually thought about driving round and round Islington, with the radio on, shouting at it.
author: David Nobbs
title: It Had to Be You

quote: Eventually I track the phone down by the green light on top. Notice that the time display reads 06:24 before I answer. It's Mum. 'Hi,' I say.
author: Serena Mackesy
title: Simply Heaven

quote: Simon is happy to travel scum class when he's on his own and even sometimes deliberately aims for the 6.25.
author: Mark Lawson
title: The Deaths

quote: No lights were on in the master bedroom at this time but it is noted that the official time of sunrise for this date is 0626 hours. Victim is quite clear that sufficient light was entering via the large picture window to allow good visibility.
author: Don & Linda Pendleton
title: Roulette

quote: 06:27:52 by the chip in her optic nerve; Case had been following her progress through Villa Straylight for over an hour, letting the endorphin analogue she'd taken blot out his hangover.
author: William Gibson
title: Neuromancer

quote: At 06.27 hours on 1 January 1975, Alfred Archibald Jones was dressed in corduroy and sat in a fume-filled Cavalier Musketeer Estate face down on the steering wheel, hoping the judgement would not be too heavy upon him.
author: Zadie Smith
title: White Teeth

quote: I beg to report the following. 1. At 06.28 yesterday, I was ordered to attend the recovery of a body from the Havel.
author: Robert Harris
title: Fatherland

quote: I sat up. There was a rug over me. I threw that off and got my feet on the floor. I scowled at a clock. The clock said a minute short of six-thirty.
author: Raymond Chandler
title: The Big Sleep

quote: Six-thirty was clearly a preposterous time and he, the client, obviously hadn't meant it seriously. A civilised six-thirty for twelve noon was almost certainly what he had in mind, and if he wanted to cut up rough about it, Dirk would have no option but to start handing out some serious statistics. Nobody got murdered before lunch. But nobody. People weren't up to it. You needed a good lunch to get both the blood-sugar and blood-lust levels up. Dirk had the figures to prove it.
author: Douglas Adams
title: The Long Dark Tea-time of the Soul

quote: It was now 06:31 and still dark, but the lower ranks who were saddled with the daily task of lighting fires, fetching and heating water and preparing food would soon be up and moving around.
author: Patrick Tilley
title: Earth-Thunder

quote: The familiar radium numerals on my left wrist confirmed the clock tower. It was twenty-eight minutes to seven. I seemed to be filling a set of loud maroon pajamas which were certainly not mine. My vis-a-vis was wearing a little number in yellow.
author: Dana Chambers
title: Too Like the Lightning

quote: He got to work. When he pulled up his final calculations, the actual liftoff worked out to 06:33 if they wanted to follow the most optimal course toward transit. While bringing the star map on line, he wondered how close to his liftoff Rufus would come. He'd been doing pretty well lately.
author: Darrell Bain
title: Long Way Home

quote: If Haglund had gone to ground for the night, they were probably taking it in turns to sleep, and she didn't want to risk waking him. She would receive a message if anything occurred. Instead she found a Swedish music channel to help her stay awake. Although she stopped at a petrol station to use the toilet and buy a soft drink, it was only 06.34 when she arrived in Ystad.
author: Jorn Lier Horst
title: The Hunting Dogs

quote: It's really down to what's allowed and what isn't, continued the pilot's train of thought - and as trains of thought go, this one's the Sundays-only 06.34 service from Llanelli, stopping at all stations to Neath; because if the pilot had enough brain to half-fill the cap of the average biro, he'd still be cruising at sixty thousand feet, with the intercom switched firmly off - and this has got to be something that isn't.
author: Tom Holt
title: Here Comes the Sun

quote: The clock says it's 06:34 so I definitely need at least another week of sleep, but apparently my body has decided it doesn't want to go through any more dreams like that so it actively refuses to go back under.
author: Beth Thomas
title: His Other Life

quote: My radio-alarm glowed 06:35 in numerals of Mekon green; 150 minutes of life left, that was all.
author: David Mitchell
title: Black Swan Green

quote: 'Uh, we got a call, at, ummm â¦ 06:36 â¦ and I sent Eight up on it. He got there, and thinks we should, uh, probably have you come up and take a look.' Her voice seemed to be about an octave higher than usual. 'Eight' referred to Nation County Sheriff's Car Eight, the radio call sign of Tom Borman, a newish deputy with about two years' service.
author: Donald Harstad
title: Code 61

quote: The dashboard clock said 6.37am. Town frowned, and checked his wristwatch, which blinked that it was 1.58pm. Great, he thought. I was either up on that tree for eight hours, or for minus a minute.
author: Neil Gaiman
title: American Gods

quote: The clock on the dashboard said it was 6.38am. He left the keys in the car, and walked toward the tree.
author: Neil Gaiman
title: American Gods

quote: He fired another torpedo at 0639 hours from a distance of 500 metres. Again it missed its intended target, but exploded seven minutes later. The torpedoes would only detonate on impact with a solid object.
author: Keith Jessop & Neil Hanson
title: Goldfinder

quote: Claire drove me to the office, where at six-forty I was not surprised to see my Lexus parked among several other imports. The lot was never empty. We had people who slept at the office.
author: John Grisham
title: The Street Lawyer

quote: A car drove past at a crawl, its driver eyeing her curiously through the slow-moving windscreen wipers, and she pretended to rummage for something in her pocket, trying to look like a normal person, on her way to a normal day. It was nineteen minutes to seven. She heard a familiar voice, carrying towards her on the wind.
author: Jojo Moyes
title: The Horse Dancer

quote: It was 06:42 and he'd just finished his solo morning workout: three circuits of Ring 7 â the second-longest ring in the hab-disk â followed by a half hour pushing and pulling against resistance channels in the gym.
author: Tim C. Taylor
title: Marine Cadet

quote: To London on the 6.43am. Jessica is back from her holiday. Things are looking up, she called me Chris, instead of Minister, when we talked on the phone this afternoon.
author: Chris Mullin
title: A View From the Foothills

quote: Simon is happy to travel scum class when he's on his own and even sometimes deliberately aims for the 6.25. But today the .25 is delayed to 6.44.
author: Mark Lawson
title: The Deaths

quote: He was still hurriedly thinking all this through, unable to decide to get out of the bed, when the clock struck quarter to seven. There was a cautious knock at the door near his head. 'Gregor', somebody called - it was his mother - 'it's quarter to seven. Didn't you want to go somewhere?'
author: Franz Kafka
title: Metamorphosis

Many a long year before that, in one of the bygone centuries, a worthy citizen of Wrychester, Martin by name, had left a sum of money to the Dean and Chapter of the Cathedral on condition that as long as ever the Cathedral stood, they should cause to be rung a bell from its smaller bell-tower for three minutes before nine o'clock every morning, all the year round.

Flowed up the hill and down King William Street, To where Saint Mary Woolnoth kept the hours With a dead sound on the final stroke of nine.

Away they tore, full of fallacious hope, out at the cloisters, through the cathedral precincts, along the nearest streets, and arrived within the given four minutes, rather than over it.

quote: That's something I've always just about avoided, but tomorrow morning at five minutes past nine this is going to happen.

quote: 9.08am rolled over onto left side.

In another sense, on the contrary, our trains, in this latitude, gain over the sun more than 900 kilometres an hour, beating that planet hand over hand: quitting Liverpool at noon, for example, the traveller will reach the station where we now are at thirty-four minutes past nine in the morning - that is to say, earlier than he started! Ha! Ha! I don't think one can travel quicker than that!' I did not know what to think.

quote: 9.50am. Hmmm. Think will go inspect make-up in case he does come in

quote: It was two minutes after ten; she was not satisfied with her clothes, her face, her apartment. She heated the coffee again and sat down in the chair by the window. Can't do anything more now, she thought, no sense trying to improve anything the last minute.

quote: But for this change certain things would happen twelve days from now. For instance, Nikolaus would save Lisa from drowning. quote: At five minutes past ten o'clock, there approached the spot where Dick stood waiting in the Mall a very charming girl of scarcely twenty years of age, of medium height, with a pretty, plump form delightfully outlined by the lines of her walking dress. This was of a gray cloth, perfectly cut, but almost military in its severity. Her mouth was small and proud, her eyes gray and solemn, her color high from walking in the chilly air, and her hair of that nondescript brown usually described as fair. Uncommon, yet not sensational; but with a delicate charm that radiated from her like perfume from a flower.

quote: 'The doomed man ate a hearty breakfast of ham and eggs and seemed in good spirits.' Reporters, with a sense of the dramatic, usually wrote it that way. Ham and eggs were a symbol. Should he mull around for extenuating epigramsâa fervid rigmarole on the mysteries and ethics of life? Or strike swift, short?... 'Death was instantaneous. The drop fell at 10:08 A.M. sharp.' Always sharp. Damn his reporters!

quote: As for me, if I rolled off the 10:09 to a rosebud-strewn path and was thrown to the mat as Jules' matron of honor during a quickie marriage ceremony, I'd be no more shocked than if she announced that we were guests at her bon voyage party before she emigrated to New Zealand to raise goats.

His last sight was the airspeed indicator scrolling past Mach 6.1. Almost four thousand miles per hour. The starship Daedalus had just gone hypersonic.
author: Thomas Hoover
title: Project Daedalus

quote: 'By the bye,' said the first, 'I was able this morning to telegraph the very words of the order to my cousin at seventeen minutes past ten.' 'And I sent it to the Daily Telegraph at thirteen minutes past ten.'n 'Bravo, Mr. Blount!' 'Very good, M. Jolivet.' 'I will try and match that!'
author: Jules Verne
title: Michel Strogoff

quote: I know that it was 10:18 when I got home because I look at my watch a lot.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer
title: Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close

quote: 'This is what Sterling High School looked like at 10:19 a.m. on March 6, 2007. Ed McCabe never got to give his homework assignment to his math class, because nineteen minutes earlier, Peter Houghton, a seventeen-year-old junior at Sterling High School, burst through the doors with a knapsack that contained four guns-two sawed-off shotguns, as well as two fully loaded, semiautomatic 9-millimeter pistols.'
author: Jodi Picoult
title: Nineteen Minutes

quote: How much is the clock fast now? His mother straightened the battered alarm clock that was lying on its side in the middle of the mantelpiece until its dial showed a quarter to twelve and then laid it once more on its side. An hour and twenty-five minutes, she said. The right time now is twenty past ten.
author: James Joyce
title: A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man

quote: Liz Headleand stares into the mirror, as though entranced. She does not see herself or the objects on her dressing-table. The clock abruptly jerks to 10.21.
author: Margaret Drabble
title: The Radiant Way

quote: ...before I had time to figure out what to do, or even what to think or feel, the phone started ringing. It was 10:22:27. I looked at the caller ID and saw that it was him.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer
title: Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close

quote: The date was the 14th of May and the clock on his desk said the time was twenty three minutes past ten, so he tapped in the numbers 10.23. At least, that's what he meant to do. In fact he typed in the numbers 10.03
author: Andrew Norriss
title: Ctrl-Z

quote: Decker pulled the white Volkswagen up to the kerb outside Kang's convenience store at 10.24 on Tuesday morning, and he and Mangle climbed out.
author: R D Ronald
title: The Zombie Room

quote: Arnet entered the Peabody Wildlife Management Area at 10:24 A.M., crested a ridge, and noticed fresh skid marks leading to dark, pool-like stains near the side of the road.
author: Mark T. Sullivan
title: Labyrinth

quote: 10:25: Phone call from LÃ¼ding, very worked up, urging me to return at once and get in touch with Alois, who was equally worked up.
author: Heinrich BÃ¶ll
title: The Lost Honour of Katharina Blum

quote: In the exact centre of my visual field was the alarm clock, hands pointing to ten-twenty-six. An alarm clock I received as a memento of somebody's wedding.
author: Haruki Murakami
title: Hard-Boiled Wonderland And The End Of The World

quote: Mr. Harcourt woke up with mysterious suddenness at twenty-seven minutes past 10, and, by a curious coincidence, it was at that very instant that the butler came in with two footmen laden with trays of whisky, brandy, syphons, glasses, and biscuits.
author: A.G. Macdonell
title: England, Their England

quote: At 10:28 Crow was leaning on the seawall at the spot where the Amber dummy had been concealed on the other side. The rain made everything slightly murky.
author: Robert B. Parker
title: Stranger in Paradise

quote: After a while I got the hang of the thing and kept one leg jammed against the struts throughout the examination. It was about 10.30 a.m.
author: James Herriot
title: All Things Wise and Wonderful

quote: At ten-thirty I'm cleaned up, shaved and dressed in my Easter best - a two-piece seersucker Palm Beach I've had since college.
author: Richard Ford
title: The Sportswriter

quote: In fact he was just sitting down to a nice little second breakfast in the dining-room by the open window, when in walked Gandalf. 'My dear fellow,' said he, 'whenever are you going to come? What about an early start?âand here you are having breakfast, or whatever you call it, at half past ten! They left you the message, because they could not wait.'
author: J. R. R. Tolkien
title: The Hobbit

quote: Inspector Sanderson has told us that he examined the safe at 10.31 a.m. and found two good-sized drops of blood on the bottom.
author: R. Austin Freeman
title: The Red Thumb Mark

quote: 'What's wrong?' Rook arrived behind them, his breath smelling of contraband espresso. 'It's the damn time code.' She tapped her pen on the pale gray digital clock embedded on the bottom of the surveillance video. 'It shows Miric and Pochenko arriving at 10:31 A.M.
author: Richard Castle
title: Heat Wave

quote: Date: Sat, 16 May 2009 10:32 AM Subject: RE: Meteorite Dear Alex, I'm very well (thank you for asking), and I'm delighted to hear that you're feeling so much better. With regard to your meteorite, this is an extremely generous offer (and a very welcome one!) but I need to be sure that it's definitely what you want.
author: Gavin Extence
title: The Universe versus Alex Woods

quote: 'That's easy. She called him up from home. We checked the phone logs at the paper. And her phone bill. The time checks out. December 12, 10:33 A.M. James said the caller disguised their voice. We found a commercial voice changer at the house, in her bedroom.'
author: Chuck Logan
title: The Big Law

quote: At 10:34 a.m. on 198.088, the lights went out in Labrador, and the backup generators came on, but Labrador's sunline stayed off.
author: Kim Stanley Robinson
title: Aurora

quote: Five-and-twenty to eleven. A horrible hour - a macabre hour, for it is not only the hour of pleasure ended, it is the hour when pleasure itself has been found wanting.
author: Patrick Hamilton
title: Rope

quote: 'Strand post mark and dispatched ten thirty-six' said Holmes reading it over and over. 'Mr Overton was evidently considerably excited when he sent it over and somewhat incoherent in consequence.'
author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
title: The Adventure of the Missing Three-Quarter

quote: I quite agree with you,' said Mr Murbles. 'It is a most awkward situation. Lady Dormer died at precisely 10.37 a.m. on November 11th.'
author: Dorothy L. Sayers
title: The Unpleasantness at the Bellona Club

quote: It was 10.38 a.m., and I had driven 6,842 miles since leaving home thirty-four days earlier. I circled this figure, then got out, grabbed my bags from the trunk, and walked briskly to the house.
author: Bill Bryson
title: The Lost Continent

quote: However, I can't allow you to pay for my travel expenses, as we are strangers and nothing may come of our meeting. My flight arrives at 10:39 a.m.
author: Linda Howard
title: Duncan's Bride

quote: 10:40: Call from Katharina asking me whether I had really said what was in the News.
author: Heinrich BÃ¶ll
title: The Lost Honour of Katharina Blum

quote: An old man in a condominium apartment facing the sea was looking out his sixth-floor window at the time of the explosion and was able to fix the time of it at precisely 10:41 Eastern Daylight Time.
author: John D. MacDonald
title: Cinnamon Skin

quote: We're running short of time. It's 10:42 and the meeting is due to start in just a kilosec or so.
author: Charles Stross
title: Glasshouse

quote: 24 January, 10.43 a.m: one month and two days later I wonder if I should worry about the fact that my darling boyfriend bought me a birthday present that has the potential to cause instant death...
author: Jane Costello
title: The Wish List

quote: At 10:44 A.M., having slept little more than two hours, Krait was roused from dreamless sleep by the vibrating cell phone that he still cupped in his hand. Instantly awake, he threw back the covers and sat on the edge of Teresa Mendez's bed to read what proved to be an annoying coded text message from his support group. They had two questions.
author: Dean Koontz
title: The Good Guy

quote: I didn't get your note until after 10.45 to be precise.' 'Don't be precise,' said Dwalin, 'and don't worry! You will have to manage without pocket-handkerchiefs, and a good many other things, before you get to the journey's end.
author: J. R. R. Tolkien
title: The Hobbit

quote: OLIVE. [At KATHERINE'S elbowâexamining her watch on its stand] It's fourteen minutes to eleven. KATHERINE. Olive, Olive! OLIVE. I just wanted to see the time. I never can go to sleep if I tryâit's quite helpless, you know. Is there a victory yet? [KATHERINE, shakes her head] Oh! I prayed extra special for one in the evening papers. [Straying round her mother] Hasn't Daddy come?
author: John Galsworthy
title: The Mob

quote: He whistles in the shower. It is 10.47 and he is ready for the off.
author: Jackie Kay
title: Trumpet

quote: At 10.48am, I closed my folder but didn't bother putting it back in my bag, so you knew I was on my way to a committee or meeting room nearby. Before I stood up, I folded my paper napkin and put it and the spoon into my coffee cup, a neat sort of person, you thought.
author: Louise Doughty
title: Apple Tree Yard

quote: By forty-nine minutes past ten, we fall in again with a fine portion of the ancient road, which the modern track constantly follows, and descend by some steep windings, hewn in the side of a precipitous cliff, to the place where the Ouad-el-Haoud commences.
author: FÃ©licien de Saulcy
title: Narrative of a Journey round the Dead Sea and in the Bible lands in 1850 and 1851

quote: As he walked back to the flight office, airmen were forming a line to await the arrival of the NAAFI van with morning tea and cakes. Lambert looked at his watch; it was ten to eleven.
author: Len Deighton
title: Bomber

quote: Shadle's interest in porcupine-human interaction had been longstanding. It began at or about 10:50 a.m. on 20 January 1947: 'During the examination of one of the porcupines in the vivarium of the University of Buffalo, the animal became excited, and, as a result of its struggle, fell backwards from the porcelain top of the table.
author: Marc Abrahams
title: This Is Improbable

quote: At nine minutes to eleven on Monday a blond young woman with what amounted to a crew cut came out of Susan's office and took her yellow slicker off the rack and went out of the waiting room without looking at me.
author: Robert Parker
title: Crimson Joy

quote: It was now eight minutes to eleven, and he began to feel rather cross and impatient. There was nothing to do in the big, ugly, stately room into which he had been shown.
author: Marie Belloc Lowndes
title: From out the Vasty Deep

quote: He begins to make a record of our observations.'10.53 hrs,' he writes, as we crouch at the top of the stairs, listening to his mother in the hall below.
author: Michael Frayn
title: Spies

quote: She glanced at the clock over the sink. It was 10:54 A.M. Her telephone call would come in a minute. They came at different times each morning and she had a plastic laminated chart that told her what time to expect the call on each day.
author: Warren Murphy & Richard Sapir
title: Last Call

quote: I'm telling you that you paid 6495 into Bennington's Bank in the High Street at 10.54 a.m. today, insisted Frost. 'And I'm telling you I did not,' spat the man.
author: R. D. Wingfield
title: Hard Frost

quote: The clock was still saying five minutes to eleven when Pooh and Piglet set out on their way half an hour later.
author: A. A. Milne
title: The House at Pooh Corner

quote: 'Here's your clock, Katy,' he said. 'I've got it fixed so that it strikes all right. Only you must be careful not to hit the striker when you start the pendulum.' 'Have you, really?' said Katy. 'Why, Dorry, you're a genius! I'm ever so much obliged.' 'It's four minutes to eleven now,' went on Dorry.
author: Susan Coolidge
title: What Katy Did

quote: They came back out at three minutes to eleven, and they both went to the rear of the truck. The driver unlocked the door, the guard climbed back in, the driver shut and locked the door again.
author: Richard Stark
title: The Man with the Getaway Face

quote: One day Joe was sitting in the office waiting for his 11 o'clock appointment, and at 10:58 this black gal came in.
author: Helen DeWitt
title: Lightning Rods

quote: Last year I stepped into the house at 10:58 exactly, heart hammering in my chest, shaking with exhaustion â I'd had to sprint home.
author: Lauren Oliver
title: Delirium

quote: Harry grunted in his sleep and his face slid down the window an inch or so, making his glasses still more lopsided, but he did not wake up. An alarm clock, repaired by Harry several years ago, ticked loudly on the sill, showing one minute to eleven.
author: J. K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

quote: It was about eleven o'clock in the morning, mid October, with the sun not shining and a look of hard wet rain in the clearness of the foothills. I was wearing my powder-blue suit, with dark blue shirt, tie and display handkerchief, black brogues, black wool socks with dark blue clocks on them. I was neat, clean, shaved and sober, and I didn't care who knew it.
author: Raymond Chandler
title: The Big Sleep

quote: As they looked the whole world became perfectly silent, and a flight of gulls crossed the sky, first one gull leading, then another, and in this extraordinary silence and peace, in this pallor, in this purity, bells struck eleven times the sound fading up there among the gulls.

title: Mrs Dalloway

quote: O'Neil rises and takes the tray. He has finished the tea, but the muffins are still here in a wicker basket covered with a blue napkin. The clock above the stove says that it is just past eleven, and guests will be arriving at the house now.

title: Mary and O'Neil

quote: I am 'hibakusha.' I lost my sight at 11:02 A.M., August 9, 1945, by your calendar. I was standing on Mount Kompira, manning the air-raid warning station with several other boys from my class.
author: Max Brooks
title: World War Z

quote: Date: Sun, 2 Jun 2013, 11:03 AM Subject: (No Subject) Bravo, Miss Williams My editor tells me that I'm currently number one on Amazon's poetry bestsellers list (another oxymoron I'm sure you'll appreciate). We're in danger of hitting five figures. I think I may have underestimated you.
author: Gavin Extence
title: The Mirror World of Melody Black

quote: On the fourth, at 11.03am, the editor of the Yidische Zaitung put in a call to him; Doctor Yarmolinsky did not answer. He was found in his room, his face already a little dark, nearly nude beneath a large, anachronistic cape.

title: Death and the Compass

quote: Consequently we are happy to announce that since the excess excuses have now been used, the 11.04 DeepDrop to Sydney is ready for boarding at Gate Six.'
author: Jasper Fforde
title: Lost in a Good Book

quote: Sansom arrived in a Town Car at five past eleven. Local plates, which meant he had ridden up most of the way on the train. Less convenient for him, but a smaller carbon footprint than driving all the way, or flying. Every detail mattered, in a campaign.
author: Lee Child
title: Gone Tomorrow

quote: Despite the remaking of the BookWorld, some books remained tantalisingly out of reach. The entire Sherlock Holmes canon was the most obvious example. It was entirely possible that they didnât know there was a BookWorld, and still thought they were real. A fantastic notion, until you consider that up until 11.06 a.m. on 12 April 1948, everyone else had thought the same.
author: Jasper Fforde
title: One of Our Thursdays is Missing

quote: 'Since this morning,' added Mabelle. 'It was at exactly six minutes past eleven that we found ourselves linked in a close embrace.'
author: P. G. Wodehouse
title: Blandings Castle and Elsewhere:

quote: At exactly seven minutes past eleven by the ship's clock the Adventurer gave a prolonged screech and, moorings cast off, edged her way out of the basin and dipped her nose in the laughing waters of the bay, embarked at last on a voyage that was destined to fully vindicate her new name.
author: Ralph Henry Barbour
title: The Adventure Club Afloat

quote: The bursar was standing in the hall with his arms folded across his chest and when he caught sight of the fat young man he looked significantly at the clock. It was eight minutes past eleven.
author: James Joyce
title: Stephen Hero

quote: The last was October 12 at 11:09 a.m. 'It took him all of five weeks,' I said. 'Exceptâ¦' The words wouldn't come out. In fact, I was afraid if I opened my mouth I would throw up.
author: James Patterson
title: NYPD Red 3

quote: 'Very good. I want to start by the 11:10 from Waterloo.' 'That would give me time.' 'Then, if you are not too sleepy, I will give you a sketch of what has happened, and of what remains to be done.'
author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
title: The Crooked Man

quote: Ten minutes after eleven in Archie McCue's room on the third floor of the extension to the Robert Matthews' soaring sixties' tower - The Queen's Tower, although no queen was ever likely to live in it.
author: Kate Atkinson
title: Emotionally Weird

quote: We are the ship's artificial intelligences, bundled now into a kind of pseudo-consciousness, or something resembling a decision-making function, the nature of which is not clear to us, but be that as it may, we locked all the locks between the biomes, 11:11 a.m., 170.182.
author: Kim Stanley Robinson
title: Aurora

quote: I squinted down the street at the bank clock: 11:12, 87 degrees. 'It's only a block and a half and it's not that hot, Daddy. The walk will do you good.' This conversation made me breathless, as if I were wearing a girdle with tight stays.

title: A Thousand Acres

quote: She didn't look where she was going, but apparently it didn't matter as she drifted straight through a marble column with no problem. 'We're out of prime time now, so that's good,' she mused. 'I can fit you in right before his 11:12 spot.'

title: The Lost Hero

quote: Hassleholm 11.13 a.m. Then she left. She knew the timetable by heart.
author: Henning Mankell
title: The Fifth Woman

quote: The report was dated Sunday, 25 September, 1966, at 11.14am. The text was laconic. Call from Hrk Vanger; stating that his brother's daughter (?) Harriett Ulrika Vanger, born 15 June 1960 (age 1960) has been missing from her home on Hedley Island since Saturday afternoon.
author: Stieg Larsson
title: The Girl With The Dragon Tattoo

quote: 'What's with the 'iMagic' name change?' I said without preamble. 'Industrial Magic was a bit of a mouthful,' he explained. 'Besides, putting 'i' in front of anything makes it more hip and current. Is that why you called?' 'No. We've got a ten-kilo spell cooking at eleven fifteen this morning and I wanted to make sure we wouldn't clash.'
author: Jasper Fforde
title: The Song of the Quarkbeast

quote: It's 11:16 A.M.; I've been cutting for over forty minutes. With my fingers, I take an inventory of what I have left: two small clusters of muscle, another artery, and a quarter circumference of skin nearest the wall. There is also a pale white nerve strand, as thick as a swollen piece of angelhair pasta. Getting through that is going to be unavoidably painful.
author: Aron Ralston
title: 127 Hours

quote: Mrs. Mooney glanced instinctively at the little gilt clock on the mantelpiece as soon as she had become aware through her revery that the bells of George's Church had stopped ringing. It was seventeen minutes past eleven...
author: James Joyce
title: Dubliners

quote: It is 11.18. A row of bungalows in a round with a clump of larch tree in the middle.
author: Jackie Kay
title: Trumpet

quote: A whistle cut sharply across his words. Peter got onto his knees to look out the window, and Miss Fuller glared at him. Polly looked down at her watch: 11:19. The train. But the stationmaster had said it was always late.
author: Connie Willis
title: Blackout

quote: Sweeney pointed to the clock above the bar, held in the massive and indifferent jaws of a stuffed alligator head. The time was 11.20.
author: Neil Gaiman
title: American Gods

quote: It was twenty-one minutes past eleven by the clock over the elevator doors when Joel Cairo came in from the street. His forehead was bandaged. His clothes had the limp unfreshness of too many hours' consecutive wear. His face was pasty, with sagging mouth and eyelids.
author: Dashiell Hammett
title: The Maltese Falcon

quote: The muhurat for the marriage was at 11:22 in the morning, which meant that the wedding ceremony would begin early.
author: Amulya Malladi
title: Song of the Cuckoo Bird

quote: Felix Polk of Route 16, Rural Delivery Box 12, appeared here yesterday at approximately 11:22 a.m., wanting to know if anybody had shown up with the end of his thumb because he, and I quote, 'Wanted to get it back and have it made into a key chain,' unquote.' I took a breath.
author: Craig Johnson
title: Junkyard Dogs

quote: She closed her eyes and the faces came. She opened her eyes and reached towards the bedside cupboard, took out her sleeping pills, swallowed a pill and lay down again. The music was almost raucous. She turned it off. She lay in silence, waiting for sleep. It was 11.23 a.m.
author: Michael Moorcock
title: The Black Corridor

quote: At 11:24 we thanked Helen Gillard and asked her to thank the doctor for us, left the house, walked sixty yards to Wolfe's, found the door was bolted, pushed the button and were admitted by Fritz
author: Rex Stout
title: The Final Deduction

quote: When, at about 11.25am, Katharina Blum was finally taken from her apartment for questioning, it was decided not to handcuff her at all.
author: Heinrich BÃ¶ll
title: The Lost Honour of Katharina Blum

quote: At 11:26 a.m., 0xAA289 experienced an unconnected hardware failure in one of the nodes it was running on.
