title: The Eyre Affair

quote: The clock on the 'Lal Girja's' tower stood at six minutes past three.
author: Michael Moorcock
title: Breakfast in the Ruins

quote: At seven minutes past three in the afternoon, Cecily Thorogood, that very self-possessed and prettily-clad young woman, was seated in a deck-chair on the saloon-deck of a 6,000-ton liner; an American magazine was open in front of her, under cover of which she was exploring the contents of a box of chocolates with the practised eye of the expert, in quest of a particular species which contained crystallised ginger and found favour in her sight.
author: Bartimeus
title: The Long Trick

quote: The next day was grey, threatening rain. He was there at seven minutes past three. The clock on the church over the way pointed to it. They had arranged to be there at three fifteen. Therefore, if she had been there when he came, she would have been eight minutes before her time.
author: Patrick Hamilton
title: Twenty Thousand Streets Under the Sky

quote: A private wireless telegraph which would transmit by dot and dash system the result of a national equine handicap (flat or steeplechase) of 1 or more miles and furlongs won by an outsider at odds of 50 to 1 at 3 hr 8 m p.m.
author: James Joyce
title: Ulysses

quote: On the next day he boarded the London train which reaches Hull at 3.09. At Paragon Station he soon singled out Beamish from Merriman's description.
author: Freeman Wills Crofts
title: The Pit Prop Syndicate

quote: It said ten past three. The future was amazingly like the present. 'Now we've got to find a newspaper,' said Kirsty. 'It won't be a lot of help,' said Johnny.
author: Terry Pratchett
title: Johnny and the Bomb

quote: This time it was only the simple fact that the hands chanced to point to 3.10pm, the precise moment at which all the clocks of London had stopped.
author: M. P. Shiel
title: The Purple Cloud

quote: Heart rate one thirty-two, one thirty-one, one thirty, and dropping. She was walking south on Park Avenue in the rain. The time was now eleven past three p.m.
author: Patricia Cornwell
title: The Scarpetta Factor

quote: A light breeze had sprung up since he had dropped asleep, and it felt very grateful as it caressed his damp hair and flushed face. Perhaps those three miles were nearer four, because when, tired, dusty, and heart-sick, he descried the tower of the Congregational church above the leafless elms and maples of the village, the gilded hands pointed to twelve minutes past three.
author: Ralph Henry Barbour
title: The Turner Twins

quote: Now, at this moment, he had come to the supreme test of his training. There was nothing for him to do. He had to keep calm, for now his mind was endangered. At thirteen minutes past three he began to consider the inevitability of death.
author: Olaf Ruhen
title: The Immortal

quote: If I knew that next Thursday at three fourteen I would be receiving an award for good posture, that would be great. But I'd probably get so nervous I would start slouching and the award would then be given to someone with a straighter back.
author: Obert Skye
title: Leven Thumps and the Wrath of Ezra

quote: Gordon was alone. He wandered back to the door. The strawberry-nosed man glanced over his shoulder, caught Gordon's eye, and moved off, foiled. He had been on the point of slipping Edgar Wallace into his pocket. The clock over the Prince of Wales struck a quarter past three.
author: George Orwell
title: Keep the Aspidistra Flying

quote: The Nimrod rendezvoused with the light aircraft at 1516 GMT.
author: Iain Banks
title: The Crow Road

quote: From the kitchen came the rackety-banging of the alarm-clock, proving that, as the clock was set to ring at six, Peter had found a mother for the fatherless children at just seventeen minutes past three.
author: Ellis Parker Butler
title: The Jack-Knife Man

quote: I straightened. âIâm here for Professor Cohen.â âWho?â âIrÃ¨ne Cohen.â Peeking past the woman, I saw the grandfather clock, its hands fixed at 3:17. The crystal vase was full of roses. The bookshelves now held a collection of beer steins.
author: Janet Skeslien Charl
title: The Paris Library

quote: The graphic film is already wrinkling: the eagle has a broken wing; the hour hand is kinked. It is eighteen minutes past three.
author: Paul J. McAuley
title: Fairyland

quote: At nineteen minutes past three Cecily Thorogood, still self-possessed, but no longer very prettily clad, was submerged in the chilly Atlantic up to her shoulders and clinging to the life-line of an upturned jolly-boat.
author: Lewis Anselm da Costa Ritchie
title: The Long Trick

quote: At twenty minutes past three on Monday, 26 January 1948, in Tokyo, and I am drinking and I am drinking and I am drinking and I am drinking and I am drinking and I am drinking and I am drinking and I am drinking and I am drinking â¦
author: David Peace
title: Occupied City

quote: The children came out in dribs and drabs, and it was not until shortly after twenty past three that Nandira walked out of the school entrance, carrying her school bag in one hand and a book in the other.
author: Alexander McCall Smith
title: The No. 1 Ladies' Detective Agency

quote: They tried the next block and there was a barber shop near the far corner, but when they arrived there, Della said she didn't like the looks of it. Harbin studied his wristwatch. It was now twenty-two minutes past three.
author: David Goodis
title: The Burglar

quote: Three twenty-three! Is that all? Doesn't time - no, I've already said that, thought that. I sit and watch the seconds change on the watch. I used to have a limited edition Rolex worth the price of a new car but I lost it.
author: Iain Banks
title: Espedair Street

quote: The organist, in his incredulous relief, made a horrible mess of the first bars of the wedding march. It was twenty-four minutes past three before Jimmy mouthed the first sentence of the day that even he was unable to shorten. 'I do,' he said.
author: David Nobbs
title: The Reginald Perrin Omnibus

quote: 'Hmm, let's see. It's a three-line rail-fence, a, d, g...d-a-r-l...Got it: 'Darling Hepzibah'âHepzibah? What kind of name is that?â'Will meet you Reading Sunday 15.25 train Didcot-Reading.' Reading you all right, you idiots.'
author: Tom McCarthy
title: C

quote: She ran to the window, but a wire mosquito screen was nailed across it. As she stared out she saw Korto, the cause of her desperate plight, sitting hunched up on the edge of a fountain in the empty courtyard. By banging on the wire she endeavoured to attract his attention, but he was sunk in torpid gloom. A clock showed above the stables opposite; it was twenty-six minutes past three.
author: Dennis Wheatley
title: Mediterranean Nights

quote: It was almost 15.26 so I sent a two-word message to Chris â 'All OK' â then started walking purposefully towards the nearest Portakabin, trying not to dwell too much on the insanity of what I was doing.
author: Simon Kernick
title: The Witness

quote: In this state of despondency, with infinite delight and exultation Le clearly observed, on the second day, at twenty-seven minutes past three P.M., though at a considerable distance, a mountain and an island. His joy and his pride were equal, and excessive: he called the first Alligator Mountain, in gratitude to the pears; and christened the second after his mistress, that unlucky mistress!
author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: The Voyage of Captain Popanilla

quote: Thorne was walking slowly around the small branch of WH Smith at Cambridge station, waiting for the 15.28 to King's Cross and driven back inside by the wind knifing along the platform.
author: Mark Billingham
title: Bloodline

quote: Poirot's face was very grave. 'So then, it seems possible that his death could have occurred at the time he mentioned to me - that is, at twenty-eight minutes past three.'
author: Agatha Christie
title: Regata Mystery

quote: 'Good heavens!' she said, 'it's nearly half-past three. I must fly. Don't forget about the funeral service,' she added, as she put on her coat. 'The tapers, the black coffin in the middle of the aisle, the nuns in their white-winged coifs, the gloomy chanting, and the poor cowering creature without any teeth, her face all caved in like an old woman's, wondering whether she wasn't really and in fact dead - wondering whether she wasn't already in hell. Goodbye.'
author: Aldous Huxley
title: Nuns at Luncheon

quote: I must have completed my packing with time to spare, for when the knock came on my door at half past three precisely, I had been sitting in my chair waiting for a good while. I opened the door to a young Chinese man, perhaps not even twenty, dressed in a gown, his hat in his hand.
author: Kazuo Ishiguro
title: When We Were Orphans

quote: It was after half past three when the hotel manager came to see Hetty. She had made several applications to the front desk since Sean O'Donnell had left, but to no avail.
author: Edward Rutherfurd
title: New York

quote: At 3:32 precisely, I noticed Kaitlyn striding confidently past the Wok House. She saw me the moment I raised my hand, flashed her very white and newly straightened teeth at me, and headed over.
author: John Green
title: The Fault in Our Stars

quote: I picked up my briefcase, glancing at my watch again as I did so. Three thirty-three.
author: Stephen King

quote: It was 15:34 now and the sleepiness felt like lead inside him.
author: Deon Meyer
title: Devil's Peak

quote: By three-thirty-five business really winds down. I have already sold my ladderback chairs and my Scottish cardigans. I'm not even sure now why I've sold all these things, except perhaps so as not to be left out of this giant insult to one's life that is a yard sale, this general project of getting rid quick.
author: Lorrie Moore
title: Anagrams

quote: Meanwhile a girl was standing in an airport concourse. A big clock suspended from the ceiling said it was twenty-four minutes to four.
author: Michael Marshall
title: The Intruders

quote: The explosion was now officially designated an 'Act of God'. But, thought Dirk, what god? And why? What god would be hanging around Terminal Two of Heathrow Airport trying to catch the 15.37 flight to Oslo?
author: Douglas Adams
title: The Long Dark Tea Time of the Soul

quote: Mendez took a marker and added to the line for the day Karly Vickers disappeared: 15:38 traffic ticket issued by F. Farman. He added to the line for Thursday: L. Warwick index finger in possession of D. Farman. Leone came over, tapped a finger on the line about the traffic citation, and raised his eyebrows.
author: Tami Hoag
title: Deeper than the Dead

quote: I lived two lives in late 1965 and early 1963, one in Dallas and one in Jodie. They came together at three thirty-nine in the afternoon of April 10.
author: Stephen King

quote: Why had nobody else arrived? Could he be too early? But no! They had said half past three and it was at least twenty to four. He hastened towards the gate.
author: George Orwell
title: Keep the Aspidistra Flying

quote: 'Light hair, red-checked gingham dress, and straw hat' - all she knows, indeed! Well, I'd be ashamed ter own it up, that I would, I would - and her my onliest niece what was a-comin' from 'way across the continent!' Promptly at twenty minutes to four the next afternoon Timothy and Nancy drove off in the open buggy to meet the expected guest.
author: Eleanor H. Porter
title: Pollyanna

quote: It's nineteen minutes to four. Mum and Dad are looking very stressed. Dad's put his elbow in his beer three times. A couple of secs ago a thought hit me. Perhaps they're worried that when the kids arrive, they might all try to bash me up.
author: Morris Gleitzman
title: Belly Flop

quote: At 15:41 GMT, the Cessna's engine began to cut out and the plane - presumably out of fuel - began to lose altitude
author: Iain Banks
title: The Crow Road

quote: So that, who knows? At that sudden distance I might not have even stopped, being already in motion again, raising my hand and arm in return and on, across the alley, striding on as you would naturally expect a county attorney to be striding along a side street at forty-two minutes past three in the afternoon; one whole block more for safety and then safe, inviolate still the intactness, unthreatened again.
author: William Faulkner
title: The Town

quote: He reached out a hand toward her, but she gave him such a terrible look that he pulled back and let her alone. At three forty-three, she set her jaw and kept going.
author: Holly Black
title: Doll Bones

quote: The armed response team hastily assembled from StrÃ¤ngnÃ¤s arrived at Bjurman's summer cabin at 3.44 p.m.
author: Stieg Larsson
title: The Girl Who Played With Fire

quote: I opened my notebook, flipped almost to the end before I found a blank page, and wrote 'October 5th, 3.45pm, Dunning to Longview Cem, puts flowers on parents' (?) graves. Rain.' I had what I wanted.
author: Stephen King

quote: I authorize you to leave this room at fourteen minutes to four.... Not a moment before fourteen minutes to four.... Is it understood?'
author: Maurice Leblanc
title: The Blonde Lady

quote: 'I said now, Mr. Maryk. Now, according to my watch, is not the morning, but forty-seven minutes past three. If you get no results by eight o'clock this morning I shall solve the mystery myself-noting duly for future fitness reports the failure of the board to carry out its assignment.'
author: Herman Wouk
title: The Caine Mutiny

quote: At 15:48 the satellite passed out of the 'area of interest' determined by the Madrid computer.
author: James Follett
title: Doomsday Ultimatum

quote: Anthony picked up the note and placed it beside his lordship. Then he left the room and returned to his work. Lord Pomfret was exceedingly wrath. In fact, he brooded over the incident. This augured ill for Anthony. The cold fact that in due seasonâto be precise, at eleven minutes to four that same afternoonâSlip Along won his race easily did not improve matters.
author: Dornford Yates
title: Anthony Lyveden

quote: When I arrived at the tearoom, I did a quick circuit, looking for the red hat. There were no women with red hats. My watch showed ten minutes to four.
author: Haruki Murakami
title: The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle

quote: The telegram seems to say, 'The Sovereigns and the Royal Children expect themselves at Rome tomorrow at fifty-one minutes after fifteen o'clock.'
author: Mark Twain
title: Italian Without a Master

quote: He came to a curve, and there was the lay-by, just where McCready had said it would be. He checked his watch; eight minutes to four. The road was empty.
author: Frederick Forsyth
title: The Deceiver

quote: It was like the clouds lifting away from the sun. Jodie glanced at Reacher. He glanced at the clock. Seven minutes to four. Less than three hours to go.
author: Lee Child
title: Tripwire

quote: She hurriedly fed the donkey and the remaining rabbits, and scrambled into her car at six minutes to four, the dog following her unenthusiastically. 'Your supper will have to wait until we get back,' Thea told her. 'It's too early to have it now.'
author: Rebecca Tope
title: Fear in the Cotswolds

quote: Blomkvist glanced at the clock. It was five minutes to four. 'Do you want to see her? She's still afraid that you won't want to after you found out what she did.'
author: Stieg Larsson
title: The Girl With The Dragon Tattoo

quote: At four minutes to four o'clock, Jacob presses blotting paper over the page on his desk in Warehouse Eik. He drinks another cup of water of which he shall sweat every last drop.
author: David Mitchell
title: The Thousand Autumns of Jacob de Zoet

quote: The clerk had stepped into the hall, and when he came leisurely in at three minutes to four, Caxton discovered that he had written his petition on the back of a blank marriage license.
author: Charles W. Chesnutt
title: The Colonel's Dream

quote: A hum of tolling bells makes itself heard, but not sharply. At three-fifty-eight a waiting interval. Presently a long procession of gentlemen in evening dress comes in sight and approaches until it is near to the square, then falls back against the wall of soldiers at the sidewalk, and the white shirt-fronts show like snowflakes and are very conspicuous where so much warm color is all about.
author: Mark Twain
title: The Memorable Assassination

quote: As it lacked one minute to four when Hedworth Westerling, chief of staff in name as well as power now, alighted from the gray automobile that turned in at the Galland drive, the chauffeur thought well enough of himself to forget the crush of supplies and ambulances that had delayed His Excellency's car for at least ninety seconds in the main street of the town.
author: Frederick Palmer
title: The Last Shot

quote: A little after four o'clock, Pippa meandered over to Dot's house carrying a bottle of wine she had been keeping in reserve and wondering if she could possibly be pregnant in spite of the vestigial coil still lodged in her uterus like astronaut litter abandoned on the moon.
author: Rebecca Miller
title: The Private Lives of Pippa Lee

quote: In the end, it was the Sunday afternoons he couldn't cope with, and that terrible listlessness that starts to set in about 2.55, when you know you've had all the baths you can usefully have that day, that however hard you stare at any given paragraph in the newspaper you will never actually read it, or use the revolutionary new pruning technique it describes, and that as you stare at the clock the hands will move relentlessly on to four o'clock, and you will enter the long dark teatime of the soul.
author: Douglas Adams
title: Life, the Universe and Everything

quote: He played for twenty-two days, just as he said he would. Every day at four o'clock in the afternoon, regardless of how much fighting was going on around him.
author: Steven Galloway
title: The Cellist of Sarajevo

quote: I only found out much later that those flowers were called Four O'clock, and were not magic at all. The magic was in the seed, waiting to be watered and cared for, the real magic was life.
author: Susan May Gudge
title: Ghost Generations

quote: Light is coming in through the curtains. Suddenly the digits on the clock radio look like a year. 1601. I woke up a bit early, don't have to be born for another 400 years.
author: HallgrÃ­mur Helgason
title: 101 Reykjavik

quote: I'd just looked up at the clock, to make sure time wasn't getting away from me, when I heard the shot. It was two minutes after four. I didn't know what to do.
author: Carolyn G. Hart
title: Southern Ghost

quote: She read the page carefully and then said, '16.03 - cat goes to the toilet in front garden.'
author: Catherine O'Flynn
title: What Was Lost

quote: At four past four he was aware of a rustling train's rush down the steps, and now was like a man with his neck on the block, awaiting the axe.
author: M. P. Shiel
title: The Lord of the Sea

quote: I was standing at the top of the long flight, overlooking the red brick buildings that walled the snow-filled quad and preparing to catch the trolley back to the asylum, when a tall young man with a rather ugly and bespectacled, but intelligent face, came up and said, 'Could you please tell me the time?' I glanced at my watch. 'Five past four.'
author: Sylvia Plath
title: The Bell Jar

quote: At six minutes after four, Benny's Cadillac pulled up in front of Mr. Botelia's store, and Benny's mother stepped out of the car with Penelope, who was gnawing on the tip of an ice cream cone.
author: Joanna Scott
title: Follow Me

quote: But he released him immediately because the ladder slipped from under his feet and for an instant he was suspended in air and then he realised that he had died without Communion, without time to repent of anything or to say goodbye to anyone, at seven minutes after four on Pentecost Sunday.
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
title: Love in the Time of Cholera

quote: It was eight minutes after four. I still don't have a plan. Maybe the guys in the Nova, maybe they had a plan.
author: Robert Crais
title: The Monkey's Raincoat

quote: I have to hang up now, Rosemary said. 'I just wanted to know if there was any improvement.' 'No, there isn't. It was nice of you to call.' She hung up. It was nine minutes after four.
author: Ira Levin
title: Rosemary's Baby

quote: He began speaking at ten past four. His voice was a little hoarse, and he said he had a sore throat. He paused, then said: 'I appear before the House of Commons today with the most terrible responsibility that can fall on the shoulders of any living man.'
author: Ken Follett
title: Fall of Giants

quote: 4:11 P.M. Thurs. A Huey helicopter flies east overhead as the last of the U.S. Marines make ready to leave the beach; a buzzard dangles in the thermals closer over the town.
author: Denis Johnson
title: Seek

quote: At precisely twelve minutes after four a body of cavalry rode into the square, four abreast, clearing a way for the funeral cortege.
author: J. Sydney Jones
title: The Empty Mirror

quote: But at precisely 4.13pm, the fifty thousand spectators saw the totally unexpected happen, before their very eyes. From the most crowded section of the southern grandstand, an apparition suddenly emerged.
author: Mario Vargas Llosa
title: Aunt Julia and the Scriptwriter

quote: Then at 4.14pm on March 12 I moved behind zinc-zirconium-not-to-be-revealed-compounds protecting me in this hill, and God have mercy but the struggle is just exchanged for the next one, which is exhausting me further as I say, to separate the true from the false.
author: Denis Johnson
title: Already Dead

quote: The sun had begun to sink in the west, and the shadow of an oak branch had crept across my knees. My watch said it was 4.15.
author: Haruki Murakami
title: The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle

quote: It is only a quarter past four, (shewing his watch) and you are not now in Bath. No theatre, no rooms to prepare for. Half an hour at Northanger must be enough.
author: Jane Austen
title: Northanger Abbey

quote: 4.16pm The terrace outside the bar is packed, and Igor feels proud of his ability to plan things, because even though he's never been to Cannes before, he had foreseen precisely this situation and reserved a table.
author: Paulo Coelho
title: The Winner Stands Alone

quote: In the next instant she was running toward her house, unmindful of the bags she had dropped, seeing only the police cars, knowing as she glanced down at her watch and saw that it was seventeen minutes after four, that for her time had stopped.
author: Joy Fielding
title: Life Penalty

quote: And then, over the loudspeaker, she heard an announcement: the 16.18 was due to arrive on platform two, calling at Plymouth, Liskeard, Par, St Austell, Truro, Redruth, St Erth and Penzance. For a moment she stood, at a loss, while passengers flowed past her in both directions.
author: Nicci Gerrard
title: The Moment You Were Gone

quote: Jessica [4:19 PM] Don't tease me like that. I haven't been to a play in years. Charles [4:19 PM] Then it'll be my treat. You and the hubby can have big fun on me.
author: Eric Jerome Dickey
title: The Other Woman

quote: At twenty minutes past four - or, to put it another, blunter way, an hour and twenty minutes past what seemed to be all reasonable hope - the unmarried bride, her head down, a parent stationed on either side of her, was helped out of the building...
author: J. D. Salinger
title: Raise High the Roof Beam, Carpenters

quote: 4.21pm As they started on, Doug picked up a twig and after rubbing it off, started to move one end of it inside his mouth. 'What are you doing?' Bob asked. 'Brushing my teeth, nature style,' Doug answered. Bob grunted, smiling slightly. 'I'll use my toothbrush,' he said.
author: Richard Matheson
title: Hunted Past Reason

quote: Monday, 4.22pm Washington, D.C. Paul Hood took his daily late-afternoon look at the list of names on his computer monitor.
author: Tom Clancy, Steve Pieczenik & Jeff Rovin
title: Balance of Power: Op-Center 05

quote: They were hurrying west, trying to reach the river before sunset. The warming-related 'adjustments' to Earth's orbit had shortened the winter days, so that now, in January, sunset was taking place at 4.23.
author: Jennifer Egan
title: A Visit from the Goon Squad

quote: Mike winked at Ashley and continued with the remaining greetings and hugs and handshakes. The time was 4:24. Six hours to go. The minutes seemed to just melt away.
author: Travis Thrasher
title: Teardrop

quote: Once I had established my right to exercise, one of the policemen would take me out of my cell. The first day he said, 'It is 25 to four now. You have an hour's exercise. You finish at 25 past four.'
author: Raymond Suttner
title: Inside Apartheid's Prison

quote: It seemed all wrong to have thought of such a thing. She thought, 'I don't know him. Nor does he know me. Nor ever shall we.' She put her bare hand in the sun, where the wind would weather it. It was twenty-six minutes after four.
author: Charlotte Armstrong
title: Catch-As-Catch-Can

quote: Still no sign of Juliet. Patricia gave a surreptitious glance at her watch; twenty-seven minutes past four âno! nearly twenty-eight past â Oh, hurry up, Juliet, hurry up, do!
author: Elinor Brent-Dyer
title: Visitors for the Chalet School

quote: Same day: 4.28pm- Right turn at the second bus stop after the gas station. I stopped the car at the first ward post office and inquired at the corner tobacconists. Mr. M's house was the one to the right of the post office, visible diagonally in front of me.
author: Kobo Abe
title: The Ruined Map

quote: He described the anxieties of the trip, the delay at the aerodrome, the audacities of the Parisian taxicab. 'I got there,' he finished, 'at twenty-nine past four.
author: Alec Waugh
title: Love in These Days

quote: I leave the office at four thirty, head up to Xclusive where I work out on free weights for an hour, then taxi across the park to Gio's in the Pierre Room for a facial, a manicure and, if time permits, a pedicure.
author: Bret Easton Ellis
title: American Psycho

quote: At four-thirty that afternoon in late January when I stepped into the parlour with Boo, my dog, Hutch was in his favourite armchair, scowling at the television, which he had muted.
author: Dean Koontz
title: Odd Hours

quote: No sooner had he pocketed it again than a terrible suspicion came over him. With trembling fingers he accessed the list of outgoing calls. The most recent entry was his own home number, dialled at 16.31 on 16.07.
author: Thomas Glavinic
title: Night Work

quote: At exactly 16:32 hours of a bright spring afternoon, an Iricoil tanker proceeding down the St. Lawrence Seaway fouled its propellor on a tangle of steel cables, origin unknown.
author: Anne McCaffrey
title: To Ride Pegasus

quote: At 4.33pm, a short bald man puffing on a cigar arrived at the library. He approached a huge cabinet storing thousands of alphabetically arranged cards and slid a drawer out. The tips of his fingers were bandaged.
author: JosÃ© Latour
title: Havana World Series

quote: A bedroom stocked with all the ordinary, usual things. There was a wardrobe in the corner. A bedside table with a collection of water glasses of varying ages and an alarm clock with red digital numbers - 4.34 p.m.
author: Steven Hall
title: The Raw Shark Texts

quote: It was thirty-five minutes past four. To expunge the sin of afternoon indolence, his first lapse since childhood, he washed his face in cold water three times, slapped his cheeks, and decided to walk all the way to the train station and back.
author: Aravind Adiga
title: Last Man in Tower

quote: The Voice shut itself off with a click, and then reopened conversation by announcing the arrival at Platform 9 of the 4.35 from Birmingham and Wolverhampton.
author: Agatha Christie
title: 4.50 from Paddington

quote: They watched their friend through the glass cover; the heaving of the chest became less and less, the breathing lower and lower, while a purple hue settled upon his body. At thirty-six minutes past four, the last division of the wheel had been reached.
author: Alvarado M. Fuller
title: A. D. 2000

quote: She should have been home by now. 1637. Yes. It's as if I had the date of a year on my arm. Every day is a piece of world history.
author: HallgrÃ­mur Helgason
title: 101 Reykjavik

quote: I let him put me in the car and drive me to the station. At twenty-two minutes to five by the clock in the station house I was in front of a cell in the Mill River jail.
author: Robert B. Parker
title: A Catskill Eagle

quote: Harlem enjoys lazy Sabbath mornings, although the pace picks up again in the afternoon, after church. My watch read 4:39 p.m., and I realized that I hadn't eaten all day. I bought two slices of pizza from a sidewalk vendor on 122nd and Lenox Avenue and washed it down with a grape Snapple.
author: Teddy Hayes
title: Blood Red Blues

quote: Four forty P.M. Besta sang another hymn. Everyone knew something was wrong. How long did they wait? The mayor was going crazy inside, as was the mayor's wife, as was their daughter. Seiji could barely contain his rage. He was turning as red as his red tuxedo.
author: Tip 'T.I.' Harris with David Ritz
title: Trouble & Triumph

quote: She'd opened the door at nineteen minutes to five, thinking she had some measure of control over her worldâ¦. Now she knew it for the lie it was. Everything she once thought she knew was upside-down; everything had changed.
author: Melissa James
title: Who Do You Trust

quote: I'm always happy when I reach the finish line of a long-distance race, but this time it really struck me hard. I pumped my right fist into the air. The time was 4:42pm. Eleven hours and forty-two minutes since the start of the race.
author: Haruki Murakami
title: What I Talk About When I Talk About Running

quote: It seems as if the Indian mail train that leaves Bombay at 16:43 is the train I'm destined to be on. Destiny is a word with thousands of new connotations in India.
author: Hardeep Singh Kohli
title: Indian Takeaway

quote: At sixteen minutes to five Mr Beveridge stood by the side of the Clankwood Avenue, comfortably wrapped in Dr Escort's fur coat, and smoking with the greatest relish one of Dr Escott's undeniable cigars. It was almost dark, the air bit keen, the dim park with its population of black trees was filled with a frosty, eager stillness.
author: J. Storer Clouston
title: The Lunatic at Large

quote: At four-forty-five Miss Haddon went to tea with the Principal, who explained why she desired all the pupils to learn the same duet. It was part of her new co-ordinative system.
author: E.M. Forster
title: Co-ordination

quote: At 4:46 an obese, middle-aged man shuffled in. Wearing a starched guayabera and dark green pants, UreÃ±a asked for a book on confectionery, then took a seat at the end of the same reading room. Evelina and Leticia exchanged astonished glances. It definitely was one of those days.
author: JosÃ© Latour
title: Havana World Series

quote: But maybe it was more than that, maybe Affenlight had erred badly somehow, because here it was 4:49 by his watch, 4:47 by the wall clock, and Owen had not yet come.
author: Chad Harbach
title: The Art of Fielding

quote: By four forty-eight the five-man team had her back again and the urgent struggle to save Ellen's life continued. She'd now been undergoing surgery for the best part of two hours, and it was doubtful her body could sustain much more trauma.
author: Susan Lewis
title: Taking Chances

quote: 4:49 p.m., a bald-headed man wearing khakis and ankle-high deck shoes came out through the front door of the purple house on 21st Avenue East. The detectives had nicknamed him the General.
author: Ridley Pearson
title: Beyond Recognition

quote: But at ten minutes to five a girl ran up the steps of Number Eighteen and rang the bell. She was a girl of medium height, very straight and slim; and her fair hair, her cheerful smile, and the boyish suppleness of her body all contributed to a general effect of valiant gaiety, a sort of golden sunniness
author: P. G. Wodehouse
title: Leave it to Psmith

quote: Nine minutes to five. If this wasn't some new ordeal, intended to fray her nerves to shreds, if this important person really did exist, if he'd actually set up this appointment, and if, moreover, he arrived on time, then there were nine minutes left.
author: Norman Manea
title: Compulsory Happiness

quote: The corrida was to begin at five o'clock. The five-footed beasts make a point of arriving at the latest at eight or seven minutes to: ritual again. At eight minutes to five, there they were. The urchins gave them a tap on the shoulder: another bit of ritual.
author: Henry De Montherlant
title: Chaos and Night

quote: It was so quiet in the post office that Trinidad could hear the soft tick of the clock's second hand every time it moved. It was now seven minutes before five.
author: Rita Leganski
title: The Silence of Bonaventure Arrow

quote: At six minutes before five o'clock, Daisy Robinson, about to reach her own apartment door, paused to look and to listen. Something was out of order. Tess Rogan's door was standing wide open and, from within, Daisy could hear something being broken.
author: Charlotte Armstrong
title: The Seventeen Widows of Sans Souci

quote: About five minutes to five, just as they were all putting their things away for the night, Nimrod suddenly appeared in the house. He had come hoping to find some of them ready dressed to go home before the proper time.
author: Robert Tressell
title: The Ragged Trousered Philanthropists

quote: And when that final Friday came, when my packing was mostly done, she sat with my dad and me on the living-room couch at 4:56 P.M. and patiently awaited the arrival of the Good-bye to Miles Cavalry.
author: John Green
title: Looking for Alaska

quote: Then at three minutes to five â Pendel had somehow never doubted that Osnard would be punctual â along comes a brown Ford hatchback with an Avis sticker on the back window and pulls into the space reserved for customers.
author: John le CarrÃ©
title: The Tailor of Panama

quote: I was told that in his vest pocket he kept a chronometer instead of a watch. If someone asked him what time it was, he would say, 'A minute and twenty-one seconds to five.'
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer
title: Collected Stories

quote: I do not wish, sir, said Julien to him gravely, 'to be alone for a single instant. Deign to observe,' he added, showing him the clock over their heads, 'that I have arrived at one minute to five.' 'So those little rascals at the seminary frightened you. It is very good of you to think of them,' said the abbÃ©.
author: Stendhal
title: The Red and the Black

quote: At the end of that day's work Mma Ramotswe so engineered matters that she was standing at the door of her tiny white van at precisely the time â one minute to five â that the two apprentices came out of the garage entrance, wiping their greasy hands on a handful of the loose white lint provided by Mr J. L. B. Matekoni.
author: Alexander McCall Smith
title: The Full Cupboard Of Life

quote: The rain stopped around 5 p.m. and a few of those people who were out and about expressed mild surprise when the rainbow failed to fade.
author: Nicholas Royle
title: The Rainbow

quote: The rest was death and death alone at five in the afternoon. [Lo demas era muerte y solo muerte a las cinco de la tarde]
author: Federico GarcÃ­a Lorca
title: Lament for Ignacio Sanchez Mejias

quote: We motored, I remember, leaving London in the morning in a heavy shower of rain, coming to Manderley about five o'clock, in time for tea. I can see myself now, unsuitably dressed as usual, although a bride of seven weeks, in a tan-coloured stockinette frock, a small fur known as a stone marten round my neck, and over all a shapeless mackintosh, far too big for me and dragging to my ankles.
author: Daphne du Maurier
title: Rebecca

quote: At five o'clock adieux were waved, and the ponderous liner edged away from the long pier, slowly turned its nose seaward, discarded its tug, and headed for the widening water spaces that led to old world wonders.
author: H. P. Lovecraft
title: The Horror at Red Hook

quote: One minute after five. The seated guests were told that the ceremony would begin shortly. A little more patience was required.
author: Tip 'T.I.' Harris with David Ritz
title: Trouble & Triumph

quote: She stood up, shook her hair into place, smoothed her skirt and turned on the light. It was two minutes past five. She would have thought it midnight or five in the morning.

title: Duplicate Keys

quote: 'Good evening, Mrs. Scheindlin,' the man said before departing. 'Good evening, Chris. Say hello to the wife for me.' 'I sure will. Thanks. Bye,' he said, waving to Elliot, who returned the goodbye. It was 5:03 when Elliot rested the handset in its cradle.
author: JosÃ© Latour
title: Comrades in Miami

quote: Frank Wamsley spotted his cousin Barbara and her husband and waved to them. Just ahead, he saw Marvin and his two friends. Suddenly the whole bridge convulsed. The time was 5:04 P.M. Steel screamed.
author: John A. Keel
title: The Mothman Prophecies

quote: That evening, Fanwell left the garage at his usual time, which was five minutes past five. Work ended officially at five o'clock, and Fanwell, being conscientious, insisted on working until the very last moment
author: Alexander McCall Smith
title: The Limpopo Academy Of Private Detection

quote: In her ledger the historic moment of delivery was later put at six past five, which was a lie but gave it force.
author: John le CarrÃ©
title: The Honourable Schoolboy

quote: Be ready to meet it. 'If you're turned t'other way you c'n git a quicker start if you want to run,' suggested Jim Borum, bracing himself with a fresh chew of tobacco. 'What time is it?' asked Wicker Bonner. Anderson Crow squinted up through the leafless treetops toward the setting sun; then he looked at the shadow of a sapling down on the bank. 'It's about seven minutes past five - in the evenin',' he said conclusively.
author: George Barr McCutcheon
title: The Daughter of Anderson Crow

quote: As I looked at its huge dial, and at the pendulum moving to and fro regularly and slowly in Space, as if its swinging meant to divide eternity, I saw its needles pointing to seven minutes past five.
author: H. P. Blavatsky
title: Nightmare Tales

quote: This, then, was the position in which my distant cousin Montrose found himself at eight minutes past five on this misty evening. A position calculated to test the fortitude of the sternest.
author: P. G. Wodehouse
title: Blandings Castle and Elsewhere:

quote: She looked at her watch and saw it was nine minutes past five. It's happening, Daddy! The sun's going out! Yes, he agreed.
author: Stephen King
title: Gerald's Game

quote: Five ten P.M. A ground-to-ground cruise missile, launched from a tractor installed in the backyard of Leonard Sudavico's former home by Rashan and a crew of technicians from Afghanistan, exploded onto the Paul Clay estate in the exact spot where the life-size mermaid had once swum in the waterfall.
author: Tip 'T.I.' Harris with David Ritz
title: Trouble & Triumph

quote: At eleven minutes past five Dick Bellamy stopped Melchard's car outside the booking-office of somnolent Harthborough's dead-alive station - the junction of the single-line track to Whitebay and its bathing machines with the double-track branch of the G.N.R.
author: Oliver Fleming
title: Ambrotox and Limping Dick

quote: 'Well, here we are,' said Colonel Julyan, 'and it's exactly twelve minutes past five. We shall catch them in the middle of their tea. Better wait for a bit' Maxim lit a cigarette, and then stretched out his hand to me. He did not speak.
author: Daphne du Maurier
title: Rebecca

quote: So at 17.13 Callum Green was buying a necklace and something like a couple of hours later he was dead.
author: G. J. Minett
title: Lie in Wait

quote: 'Do you know what time it is, Atticus?' she said. 'Exactly fourteen minutes past five. The alarm clock's set for five-thirty. I want you to know that.'

title: To Kill a Mockingbird

quote: When August Bach emerged from the gloomy chill of the air-conditioned Divisional Fighter Control bunker it was 17:15 hrs CET. The day had ripened into one of those mellow summer afternoons when the air is warm and sweet like soft toffee
author: Len Deighton
title: Bomber

quote: 'I think the first one I remember happening was on the London Underground, Circle line, at 17.16 p.m.' She went on to describe what had happened or not quite happened.

title: Money Never Sleeps

quote: And it was just seventeen minutes past five when Dick Ffrench, hanging in a frenzy of anxiety over the paddock fence circling the inside of the mile oval, uttered something resembling a howl and rushed to the gate to signal his recreant driver.
author: Eleanor M. Ingram
title: The Flying Mercury

quote: Lupin rose, without breaking his contemptuous silence, and took the sheet of paper. I remembered soon after that, at this moment, I happened to look at the clock. It was eighteen minutes past five.
author: Maurice LeBlanc
title: The Confessions of ArsÃ¨ne Lupin

quote: The call came at 5.19 p.m. The line was surprisingly clear. A man introduced himself as Major Liepa from the Riga police. Wallander made notes as he listened, occasionally answering a question.
author: Henning Mankell
title: The Dogs of Riga

quote: It was twenty past five and ten minutes to closing and she was running up her totals on the electronic till before watching Neighbours on TV with Marilyn her daughter who was upstairs minding her little girl.
author: John le CarrÃ©
title: The Night Manager

quote: He next proceeded to examine seriatim the dead man's pockets, turning each of them inside out and taking the contents, where they appeared adapted to his needs: for instance, a silken purse, through the interstices of which some gold was visible; a watch, which however had been injured by the explosion, and had stopt just at the moment - twenty-one minutes past five - when the catastrophe took place.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
title: The Ancestral Footstep

quote: Joubert drove there to help with the interrogation, compare alibis. Hours of listening to lies, sparring with teenage bravado and blatant provocation. But at 17:22 Lieutenant Petersen's patience eventually ran out.

title: Dead Before Dying

quote: 'I was wondering if we could meet for a drink.' 'What for?' 'Just for a chat. Do you know the Royal batsman, near Central Station? We could meet tomorrow at five?' 'Five twenty-three,' I said, to exert some control over the situation.

title: A Fraction of the Whole

quote: 'You know the game, rendezvous at...' and he looked up at the clock on the wall, '... exactly thirty hours from now at 17:24 hours and be ready to haul ass.'

title: End Run (Wing Commander)

quote: Now said Handsley, when Angela had poured out the last cup, 'it's twenty-five minutes past five, At half-past the Murder game is on'

title: A Man Lay Dead

quote: There was a pause. 'Nick?' 'There's a train that leaves Totnes at twenty-six minutes past five this afternoon,' I said, 'and it reaches London atâ'

title: Wildtrack

quote: At twenty-seven minutes past five, he rose and went indoors again; and until his death, which occurred in 1820, he never once failed to perform this incomprehensible pilgrimage.
author: Maurice Leblanc
title: The Confessions of ArsÃ¨ne Lupin

quote: Ahem! Jerry teased. 'If you want to know the time, it is twenty-seven minutes past five. Your kindred spirit should appear in three minutes.' 'Here she comes now.' Marjorie had spied Katherine coming up the walk.
author: Josephine Chase
title: Marjorie Dean, College Sophomore

quote: And so, when he told her on May 15 at 5:28 in the afternoon that he had to be moving on, she passed out. She was in his bed at the time.
author: Judy Blume
title: Smart Women

quote: Vimes pulled out the Gooseberry and stared at it. At a time like this . . . 'Well?' he said. 'It's twenty-nine minutes past five, Insert Name Here,' said the imp nervously.

title: Thud!

quote: It was half-past five before Holmes returned. He was bright, eager, and in excellent spirits, a mood which in his case alternated with fits of the blackest depression.
author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
title: In Quest of a Solution

quote: They discussed the transmission: which of their friends, they wondered, was responsible for it? But at 17:31 Pick called back.
author: Martin Amis
title: Heavy Water

quote: It was exactly thirty-two minutes past five o'clock on the evening of Friday, December 9th, when the station-master at Anerley received the following communication by wire from the signal box at Forest Hill: 5.28 down from London Bridge just passed.
author: Thomas W. Hanshew
title: Cleek, the Master Detective

quote: At 5:33 p.m. there is a blast of two deep, resonant notes a major third apart. On another day there is the same blast at 12:54 p.m. On another, exactly 8 a.m.

quote: I was as jittery as a virgin in a sorority house all day Thursday. By Friday I was certifiable. My phone rang at 5:34 in the afternoon. I had twenty-six minutes before my next client. It was Solberg.

quote: At twenty-five minutes to six he put the book back in the window-sill, dashed a few crumbs from his jacket, assumed a mortar-board cap that was lying on the tea-caddy, and went forth to his evening 'preparation duty.' The West Street was empty and shining golden with the sunset.

quote: '...at that moment I looked again at my watch because I wanted to be back at the Cathedral as Evensong ended at about twenty to six in order to talk to the choirmaster before he left. I saw I only had four minutes before it ended.' 'So that occurred at precisely twenty-four minutes before six?' 'Exactly.'
author: Charles Palliser
title: The Unburied

quote: Look, Lucille, said Joe when Lucille strolled into the office at 5:37. 'I don't know what you said to this gal, but it seems to have had exactly the opposite of the desired effect. She's got some bee in her bonnet about Harvard Law School.'

title: Lightning Rods

quote: At 17.38 the city seemed deserted. It was the first Friday in the wake of the war. The men were still at the front. The women, the elderly and the children had retreated into their homes, trying to find the will to celebrate the Sabbath.

title: The Last Of Days

quote: It's 05:39 so we can have dinner, it's quick noodles. While they're in the hot water, Ma finds hard words to test me from the milk carton like nutritional that means food, and pasteurized that means laser guns zapped away the germs.

title: Room

quote: Hey, young man, what time is it? 'What?' I said, is it 5:30 yet? 'Er, 5:40.' Heavens, they'll be starving. But then that's a good thing. Let them.'

quote: 'All right, people, let's haul ass. Sunset's at 17:41 and we've got twenty-three k to go.' Staff Sergeant Beyhn got to his feet and the platoon followed.

title: The Heart of Valor

quote: 'Well, they set sail, and after going ever so many thousand miles, or hundred - I forget which, but it don't matter - a great storm arose, a typhoon or simoon, perhaps both; and after slowly gathering up its energies for the space of twenty-nine days, seven hours, and twenty-three minutes, without counting the seconds, it burst upon them at exactly forty-two minutes past five, on the sixth day of the week.

title: The Dodge Club; Or, Italy in MDCCCLIX

quote: The first message came in at 5:43 in the afternoon, while I was at Vitality Yoga, attempting to prolong my vigor with mindful breath and deep core awareness, or at least that's what the brochure promised.

title: Elizabeth the First Wife

quote: Sometimes the heat of the fire, or the buzzing of the bluebottles on summer afternoons, would send her off into a doze, and at about a quarter to six she'd wake up with a tremendous start, glance at the clock on the mantelpiece, and then get into a stew because tea was going to be late.

quote: Janice is not waiting for him in the lounge or beside the pool when at last around 5.45 they come home from playing the par-5 eighteenth. Instead one of the girls in their green and white uniforms comes over and tells him that his wife wants him to call home.

title: Rabbit Is Rich

quote: What time did you leave there? 'It must have been about quarter to six, for I was home at six.' 'And Miss Lindsay was there when you left.' 'Oh, yes, she was there when I left.' And then, Philip Barry's secret fear was confirmed.

quote: 'Then I take it the matter is practically concluded,' said the clergyman. 'And that you very properly submit to return to your proper home. And now, if I may offer a suggestion, it is that we take tea. Freed of its tannin, nothing, I think, is more refreshing and stimulating.' 'There's a train from Lyndhurst at thirteen minutes to six,' said Widgery, unfolding a time table.
author: H. G. Wells
title: The Wheels of Chance: A Bicycling Idyll

quote: Father came home at 5:48 p.m. I heard him come through the front door. Then he came into the living room. He was wearing a lime green and sky blue check shirt and there was a double knot on one of his shoes but not on the other.
author: Mark Haddon
title: The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-time

quote: 'It's eleven minutes to six, Insert Name Here,' said the imp meekly. 'Good grief! Why didn't you tell me!' 'Because you said you didn't want to be interrupted!' the imp quavered.

quote: 'What time is it Jack?' 'Ten to six' 'Ten more minutes then.' I shuffle the cards. 'Time for a quick game of rummy?'

title: Noughts & Crosses

quote: The sun was red and the shadows were long and dark. It wanted but nine minutes to six, and within the hotel the disgraceful National Swill was in full flow, men pouring as much liquor down their throats as possible before the fatal hour of drought arrived.

quote: It was eight minutes to six o'clock. 'I must get him,' he told the telephone girl for the dozenth time. 'Sorry - no one will answer,' she said wearily.

quote: 'That boy will be spoiled, as sure as I go on springs; he's made such a lot of. Have you been regulated?' 'I should think I have!' exclaimed I, in indignant recollection of my education. 'All right; keep your temper. What time are you?' 'Seven minutes to six.'

quote: 'And yet,' Edward Henry Machin reflected as at six minutes to six he approached his own dwelling at the top of Bleakridge, 'and yet - I don't feel so jolly after all!'
author: Arnold Bennett
title: The Old Adam: A Story of Adventure

quote: 'I think we'll be lucky if we get away before they arrive.' At five minutes to six I was in position at the end of the strip with my engine running, ready for take-off.

title: Going Solo

quote: When he reached the pier gates at five minutes to six, they were closed, and the obscure vista of the pier as deserted as some northern pier in mid-winter.

quote: The clock over his head said five minutes to six. Shifting his glance from the clock, Jon became aware of a squat black robot waving to attract his attention.

quote: Now, sir, the hand wants four minutes to six. If the hour strike before you call yourself a wanton, gratuitous calumniator, I 'll flog you round the room.'

title: The Knight Of Gwynne

quote: Hugo Carmody had done this, with the result that by three minutes to six he was feeling as if he had been marooned among roses since the beginning of the summer.
author: P. G. Wodehouse
title: Summer Lightning

quote: He would make his way by charm, the charm of voice, of jewel-like language, above all by the intellectual charm of new, moving, luminous ideas. At three minutes to six the doctor closed the book and waited.
author: Guy Thorne
title: The Drunkard

quote: 'Uh â yeah. Exactly. And what's the time now?' Then I notice the windows: they're shiny dark. 17:58, insists my watch. It can't be. It's only just gone four. I peer around my tormentor's belly to find ImmaculÃ©e Constantin, but she's gone.
author: David Mitchell

quote: When he arrived it was nearly six o'clock, and the sun was setting full and warm, and the red light streamed in through the window and gave more colour to the pale cheeks.
author: Bram Stoker
title: Dracula

quote: It was nearly six o'clock in the evening, and the absurd bell in the six-foot tin steeple of the church went clank-clank, clank- clank! as old Mattu pulled the rope within.'
author: George Orwell
title: Burmese Days

quote: The newspaper snaked through the door and there was suddenly a six o'clock feeling in the house
author: Muriel Spark
title: The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie

quote: When he arrived it was nearly six o'clock, and the sun was setting full and warm, and the red light streamed in through the window and gave more colour to the pale cheeks.
author: Bram Stoker
title: Dracula

quote: King Richard: What is o'clock? Catesby: It is six o'clock, full supper time. King Richard: I will not sup tonight. Give me some ink and paper.
author: William Shakespeare
title: Richard III

quote: Although it was only six o'clock, the night was already dark. The fog, made thicker by its proximity to the Seine, blurred every detail with its ragged veils, punctured at various distances by the reddish glow of lanterns and bars of light escaping from illuminated windows.
author: ThÃ©ophile Gautier
title: Le Club des Hachichins

quote: David had followed me at one minute past six. Then three others had managed to get away, making it five altogether. But as the sixth Hurricane was gathering speed for lift-off, a swarm of Messerschmitts had come swooping in over the olive trees.
author: Roald Dahl
title: Going Solo

quote: At two minutes past six o'clock, he stood outside of the coffee house as instructed, to the right of the entrance, and waited to be contacted. Over the noise of the street traffic and the guitar, he heard a soft tuneless jangling-tinkling.

title: Sole Survivor

quote: Above it all rose the Houses of Parliament, with the hands of the clock stopped at three minutes past six. It was difficult to believe that all that meant nothing any more, that now it was just a pretentious confection that could decay in peace.

title: The Day of the Triffids

quote: 'We will make record of it, my Rosannah; every year, as this dear hour chimes from the clock, we will celebrate it with thanksgivings, all the years of our life.' 'We will, we will, Alonzo!' 'Four minutes after six, in the evening, my Rosannah...'
author: Mark Twain

quote: At about five past six Piers came in carrying an evening paper and a few books.
author: Barbara Pym
title: A Glass of Blessings

quote: 'According to the Book of Revelation, the great beast's number is 666. So that exact time would be six minutes past six on the sixth of the sixth, sixty-six. Double whammy.
author: Robert Rankin

quote: The minutes ticked by. The silence in the room roared in their ears. At seven minutes past six, Charles's phone rang.
author: Fern Michaels
title: The Jury

quote: 6:08 p.m. The code-word 'Valkyrie' reached von Seydlitz Gabler's headquarters
author: Hans Hellmut Kirst
title: The Night of the Generals

quote: Here I am, at nine minutes past six on a drizzly Saturday evening, with every intention of writing a book in one sitting.
author: Nick Spalding
title: Life... With No Breaks

quote: 'Cut the city's communications,' I said. 'Excuse me?' came the startled response. 'Do it, and call me back when it's doneâwait, Lewis! Are you there?' 'Yes, Rook Thomas.' 'How dark is it there now?' I asked. 'What?' 'How dark is it there? It's ten past six in the evening here, and it's dark.
author: Daniel O'Malley
title: The Rook

quote: The first explosion occurred at eleven minutes past six. The chart-house and part of the bridge were blown to pieces. Three dull, splintering crashes ensued in rapid succession, proving beyond question that the bombs were set to automatically explode at a given time.
author: George Barr McCutcheon
title: West Wind Drift

quote: He appeared to be haggling with the vendor about the amount of extra sauerkraut. Where was Harlequin? The clock on the tower of the Old Town Hall showed twelve minutes past six.
author: Jonathan Stroud
title: The Golem's Eye

quote: I take out my watch and it marks thirteen minutes past six. As I have already mentioned, I waited for the door of my prison to open, thoroughly resolved not to fall asleep again, but to spring upon the first person who entered and force him to answer my questions.
author: Jules Verne
title: Facing the Flag

quote: He has been for some years a victim to cataleptic attacks, on which, as is well known, Dr. Trevelyan is an authority. He proposes to call at about quarter past six to-morrow evening, if Dr. Trevelyan will make it convenient to be at home.'
author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
title: The Resident Patient

quote: Quarter past six,' said Tony. 'He's bound to have told her by now.'
author: Evelyn Waugh
title: A Handful of Dust

quote: The clock above the door said sixteen minutes past six. The pictures showed the door opening and a rug coming inâjust the rug, flat, held up perpendicular, hanging straight down. Of course there was someone behind it.

title: If Death Ever Slept

quote: The printed front of the card read Bernis Sand. On the back was written in pencil: your westbound tram stop at 18:17. There was no date or signature. At 18:17 Adele stepped out of the townhouse with Tovera at her side.

title: The Way to Glory

quote: It was at 18:18 when a sixty-one-year-old Tibetan woman telephoned for a fire engine to put out a burning car.

title: My Name is Not Jacob Ramsay

quote: I abort a groan. Gravesend's a black cloud. Vinny and Stella and Mam are in it. Are it. My watch says 18:19 and the Captain Marlow'll be cheerful and chattery as the evening regulars drift in.
author: David Mitchell
title: The Bone Clocks

quote: By the time Elliot's mother arrived at twenty past six, Mrs Sen always made sure all evidence of her chopping was disposed of.
author: Jhumpa Lahiri
title: Interpreter of Maladies

quote: 6.21 PM Miss Pettigrew found herself wafted into the passage. She was past remonstrance now, past bewilderment, surprise, expostulation. Her eyes shone. Her face glowed. Her spirits soared. Everything was happening too quickly. She couldn't keep up with things, but, by golly, she could enjoy them.
author: Winifred Watson
title: Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day

quote: Clock overturned when he fell forward. That'll give us the time of the crime. Twenty-two minutes past six.
author: Agatha Christie
title: The Murder at the Vicarage

quote: They surrounded it with excitement ... a picnic lunch in the kitchen, a double bolt drawn across the front door just in case the impossible happened and Father came home from the bank before twenty-three minutes past six in the evening.
author: Maeve Binchy
title: Light A Penny Candle

quote: We were cleared by the tower at 18:24 and got airborne seven minutes after the scheduled departure time. The evening sky was almost clear, with a scattering of cumulus along the southern horizon and the windsocks hanging limp.
